original: de yongs su gzung ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su gzung ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the thorough comprehension of those.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sa yin na zhes bya ba ni sa gang la tshad ma'i rigs pa rnam pa gsum yongs su gzung ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sa yin na zhes bya ba ni sa gang la tshad ma'i rigs pa rnam pa gsum yongs su gzung ba yod pa'o //
translated: That is the level of ordinary beings. That is the level on which there is the thorough comprehension of the three kinds of valid cognition and reasoning.

original: dge slong dag skyes bu gang zag yid la gcags pa can gyi 'chi ba ni bzang po ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag skyes bu gang zag yid la gcags pa can gyi 'chi ba ni bzang po ma yin /
translated: Monks, the death of a person who is full of regret is not good.

original: dus byed pa ni bzang po ma yin /
analyzed: dus byed pa ni bzang po ma yin /
translated: The death of one who dies at the wrong time is not good.üîΩThe death of one who dies without having completed his life span is not good.

original: tshe phyi ma ni bzang po @184b ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma ni bzang po @184b ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is a passage from a sutra.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems nyams pas 'chi ba'i phyir dang / rmongs pas 'chi ba'i phyir 'chi ba ni bzang po ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems nyams pas 'chi ba'i phyir dang / rmongs pas 'chi ba'i phyir 'chi ba ni bzang po ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Death is not good, respectively, because of the degeneration of the mind and because of delusion.

original: 'chi ba ni 'chi ba'i skad cig nyid yin par rig par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni 'chi ba'i skad cig nyid yin par rig par mi bya'o //
translated: Death should not be understood as the moment of death itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'chi bar nges pa'i yin no //
analyzed: 'chi bar nges pa'i yin no //
translated: It is the state of one who is certain to die.

original: de lta bu ni sems nyams pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni sems nyams pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Such is the state of degeneration of the mind and so on.

original: bsod nams ma byas par 'chi 'pho ba'i phyir na dus byed pa ni bzang po ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma byas par 'chi 'pho ba'i phyir na dus byed pa ni bzang po ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The death of one who dies without having completed his life span is not good because he dies without having completed his merit.

original: dus byed pa yang 'chi ba'i srid pa'i phung po dang bral ba ste 'chi 'pho ba yin no //
analyzed: dus byed pa yang 'chi ba'i srid pa'i phung po dang bral ba ste 'chi 'pho ba yin no //
translated: And death is the separation from the aggregates of the existence at death.

original: 'gro ba mi 'dod par 'gro ba'i phyir na tshe phyi ma ni bzang po ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mi 'dod par 'gro ba'i phyir na tshe phyi ma ni bzang po ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And since one goes to the next life unwillingly, it should be understood that the next life is not good.

original: tshe phyi ma yang srid pa'i kun du sbyor ba ma zad pa rnams kyi 'gro ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma yang srid pa'i kun du sbyor ba ma zad pa rnams kyi 'gro ba kho na yin no //
translated: And the next life is only the destination of those who have not exhausted the fetters of existence.

original: bzang po gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba dang / dus byed pa dang / tshe phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: bzang po gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba dang / dus byed pa dang / tshe phyi ma yin te /
translated: The three good things are death, the time of death, and the next life.

original: 'dir yang shing shun can khyod la 'dun pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang shing shun can khyod la 'dun pa'am /
translated: Here, the sutra says:

original: 'dod chags med pas khyod kyi 'chi ba ni bzang po yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pas khyod kyi 'chi ba ni bzang po yin /
translated: O you who wear tree bark, your death is good,üîΩbecause you have no desire or attachment.

original: dus byed pa ni bzang po yin /
analyzed: dus byed pa ni bzang po yin /
translated: The time of your death is good.

original: tshe phyi ma ni bzang po yin no zhes mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma ni bzang po yin no zhes mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The next life is good.

original: de ltar na phung po rnams dang bral ba tsam ni dus byed pa zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar na phung po rnams dang bral ba tsam ni dus byed pa zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: Thus, it is established that mere separation from the aggregates is called the time of death.

original: dgra bcom pa ni phung po gzhan du nying mtshams mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni phung po gzhan du nying mtshams mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arhat does not link up with another rebirth.

original: de'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni tshe phyi ma zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: de'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni tshe phyi ma zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: His nirvana is called the future life.

original: dgra bcom pa ni 'gro ba thams cad bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni 'gro ba thams cad bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: because the arhat has cut off all destinies.

original: dge slong dag de'i phyir khyed kyis tsher ma phyung ba rnams dang / tsher ma dkrugs pa rnams dang / tsher ma dang bral ba rnams dang / tsher ma med pa rnams gang yin par 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de'i phyir khyed kyis tsher ma phyung ba rnams dang / tsher ma dkrugs pa rnams dang / tsher ma dang bral ba rnams dang / tsher ma med pa rnams gang yin par 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train yourselves thinking, ‚ÄúWe will be those who have pulled out the thorns, those who have shaken out the thorns, those who are free from thorns, those who are without thorns.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the arhats are those who are without thorns.

original: dgra bcom pa ni tsher ma med pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni tsher ma med pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is a passage from a sutra.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par gyi stong pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par gyi stong pa la brten nas so //
translated: Based on the power of discernment means based on the emptiness that is the distinctive wisdom.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs la brten nas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi stobs la brten nas so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs la brten nas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi stobs la brten nas so //
translated: The phrase on the basis of the power of meditation means on the basis of the power of a special meditative absorption.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi bag la nyal gyi phyogs yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis phra rgyas brgyad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir @185a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi bag la nyal gyi phyogs yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis phra rgyas brgyad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir @185a * //
translated: The phrase because the propensities for the path of seeing have been completely destroyed means that the eight forms of innate spiritual ignorance have been completely destroyed by the path of seeing.

original: tsher ma dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: tsher ma dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase those who are free of thorns means those who are free of the afflictions.

original: 'bras bu dang po la zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la'o //üîΩgnyis pa la yang 'bras bu zhes bya bar gnas pa yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la'o // gnyis pa la yang 'bras bu zhes bya bar gnas pa yin /
translated: The phrase in the first fruit means in the fruit of the stream-winner.

original: de yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The phrase in the second fruit means in the fruit of the once-returner.

original: gsum pa la ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la ste /
translated: The phrase in the third fruit means in the fruit of the non-returner.

original: de mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase because all of them have been abandoned means that all of the fetters have been abandoned.

original: / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
translated: The Rational System of Exposition

original: bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa /
translated: Chapter Five

original: dang ba skyes nas 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: dang ba skyes nas 'gro bar byed //
translated: Having generated faith, one should go to the teacher.

original: song nas chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: song nas chos nyan par byed do //
translated: having gone there, he listens to the Dharma.

original: des chos de thos nas sems par byed do //üîΩbsams nas 'jal bar byed do //
analyzed: des chos de thos nas sems par byed do // bsams nas 'jal bar byed do //
translated: Having heard that Dharma, he reflects on it.üîΩHaving reflected on it, he investigates it.

original: bcal nas nye bar rtog par byed la /
analyzed: bcal nas nye bar rtog par byed la /
translated: Having investigated it, he thoroughly examines it.

original: bden pa de yang lus kyis mngon sum du byed cing /
analyzed: bden pa de yang lus kyis mngon sum du byed cing /
translated: And he realizes that truth with his body,üîΩand he penetrates it individually with wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis so sor 'bigs par byed do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis so sor 'bigs par byed do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the passage from the sutra.

original: 'jal bar byed pa ni rigs pas te /
analyzed: 'jal bar byed pa ni rigs pas te /
translated: He investigates it with reasoning,

original: legs par gsungs pa nyid kyi khyad par dmigs kyis 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa nyid kyi khyad par dmigs kyis 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he discerns the distinction of being well-spoken.

original: de la rigs pa tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis yin pas na rigs pas te'o //
analyzed: de la rigs pa tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis yin pas na rigs pas te'o //
translated: There, it is with reasoning because it is with the three kinds of valid cognition.

original: legs par gsungs pa nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid de /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid de /
translated: Being well-spoken is non-erroneous,

original: de'i khyad par dmigs kyis 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par dmigs kyis 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he discerns the distinction of that.

original: khyad par yang 'phags pa'i bden pa dang mthun pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par yang 'phags pa'i bden pa dang mthun pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The distinction is the teaching in accordance with the noble truths.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are like the humans of Uttarakuru.

original: thams cad kyang legs par gsungs pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir de'i khyad par bstan pa ni ji skad smos pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang legs par gsungs pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir de'i khyad par bstan pa ni ji skad smos pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Since all of them are well-spoken, therefore, the distinction of that is taught as stated.

original: yang na legs par gsungs pa nyid ni gzhan dag gi chos rnams las khyad par yin no //
analyzed: yang na legs par gsungs pa nyid ni gzhan dag gi chos rnams las khyad par yin no //
translated: Or, well-spoken is a distinction from the doctrines of others.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pas te zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam pas te'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pas te zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam pas te'o //
translated: By the aspect of cultivation means by the aspect of equipoise.

original: bden pa de yang zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa de yang zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: That truth also means the truth of cessation.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is fully understood as it really is means because it is fully and perfectly awakened to as it really is.

original: sems pas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems pas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa ston par byed do //
translated: By intention, one teaches the knowledge that arises from reflection.

original: 'jal ba dang nye bar rtogs pa nyid kyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'jal ba dang nye bar rtogs pa nyid kyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes ba ston par byed do //
translated: The terms ‚Äúappraise‚Äù and ‚Äúthoroughly understand‚Äù indicate the knowledge that arises from meditation on the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: ji ltar byas pas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis 'jal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis 'jal bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one appraise by means of the two paths of seeing and meditation?üîΩThe path of seeing appraises suchness, the path of meditation appraises the absence of error and the absence of obscuration.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni zhes bya ba @185b rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni zhes bya ba @185b rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The path of seeing appraises suchness, the path of meditation appraises the absence of error and the absence of obscuration.

original: de la de bzhin nyid ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the selflessness of persons and things.

original: de so sor rtog pa ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de so sor rtog pa ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Its thorough understanding is full enlightenment.

original: sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The absence of error and the absence of obscuration are due to the absence of superimposition and the absence of denial.

original: bdag gam bdag gi'o zhes sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi'o zhes sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: The absence of superimposition is the absence of the thought ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine.‚ÄùüîΩThe absence of denial is the absence of the thought ‚ÄúThere is no maturation,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThere is no truth of suffering, etc.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa med do zhes skur ba mi 'debs pas mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir de ltar na 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa med do zhes skur ba mi 'debs pas mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir de ltar na 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one appraises by means of the path of seeing and meditation.

original: gnas gyur pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa nyid kyis te /
translated: By means of the transformation itself.

original: rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment of liberation.

original: gnas gyur pas na gnas gyur pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnas gyur pas na gnas gyur pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The transformation itself is the transformation.

original: ji ltar na gnas gyur pa nyid kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas gyur pa nyid kyis she na /
translated: How is it by means of the transformation itself?

original: rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba yang sems nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yang sems nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the mind's freedom from the negative reflex actions of the latent proclivities of the defilements.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyis so zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa la ye shes 'byung ba ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyis so zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa la ye shes 'byung ba ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes te /
translated: By means of the knowledge of liberation. The knowledge of liberation is the occurrence of knowledge in regard to the characteristics of liberation as they have been described.

original: rnam par grol ba la dmigs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la dmigs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that has liberation as its objective support.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de lta na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de lta na'o //
translated: Thus, etc. Thus means in the way that has been described.

original: dad pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa skyes nas 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis ston par byed do //
analyzed: dad pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa skyes nas 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis ston par byed do //
translated: Having faith, etc. The words, having faith, having gone for refuge, etc. indicate that one should go for refuge after faith has arisen.

original: tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam ston par byed pa ni chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam ston par byed pa ni chos nyan par byed do //
translated: He teaches the path together with its equipment, he listens to the Dharma.üîΩBy these two statements, he teaches the equipment.

original: des chos de thos nas sems par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni tshogs ston par byed do //
analyzed: des chos de thos nas sems par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni tshogs ston par byed do //
translated: Having heard that Dharma, he reflects on it.

original: bsams nas 'jal bar byed do //
analyzed: bsams nas 'jal bar byed do //
translated: Having reflected, he meditates.üîΩHaving meditated, he penetrates it with his wisdom.

original: bcal nas nye bar rtog par byed la zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam gnyi ga kun du ston par byed do //
analyzed: bcal nas nye bar rtog par byed la zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam gnyi ga kun du ston par byed do //
translated: By these two statements, he teaches the path.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu rnam par grol ba kun du ston par byed pa ni bden pa de yang lus kyis mngon sum du byed cing zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu rnam par grol ba kun du ston par byed pa ni bden pa de yang lus kyis mngon sum du byed cing zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: He teaches the result of the path, which is liberation, by the statement, He realizes that truth with his body.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kun du ston par byed pa ni shes rab kyis so sor 'bigs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kun du ston par byed pa ni shes rab kyis so sor 'bigs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: He teaches the knowledge of liberation by the statement, He penetrates it with his wisdom.

original: dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can gyis gang gi bsod snyoms yongs su spyod nas sems la tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas na gzhi de las sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gi
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can gyis gang gi bsod snyoms yongs su spyod nas sems la tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas na gzhi de las sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gi
translated: If a fully ordained monk who has ethical conduct and virtuous qualities, after consuming the alms of another, manifests and abides in limitless states of mind and the meditative absorption of the body, then from that basis the donor and benefactorüîΩ

original: bsod nams rgyun rgyas pa dang / dge ba @186a * //
analyzed: bsod nams rgyun rgyas pa dang / dge ba @186a * //
translated: When a monk who is endowed with morality and virtuous qualities consumes the alms of another, and then, having actualized the immeasurable mental concentration in his body, and having completed it, abides in it, then, on the basis of that, it should be understood that the immeasurable merit of the donor and the benefactorüîΩincreases, and that the immeasurable happiness which is the result of virtue

original: rgyun rgyas pa dang / bde ba 'dren pa tshad med pa yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyun rgyas pa dang / bde ba 'dren pa tshad med pa yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: increases. This is the passage from the sutra.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni bag yod pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms la sogs pa dge ba mang po pa rnams so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni bag yod pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms la sogs pa dge ba mang po pa rnams so //
translated: The words faith, etc., include many virtues such as heedfulness, fitness, and equanimity.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag gi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag gi'o //
translated: The word his refers to the benefactor.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i bag chags gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i bag chags gnyis so //
translated: The words those two refer to the two habitual propensities as previously explained.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba 'grub bar byed pa'i bag chags brtas pa'i khyad par du 'gro ba dag ni bsod nams rgyun byas pa tshad med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba 'grub bar byed pa'i bag chags brtas pa'i khyad par du 'gro ba dag ni bsod nams rgyun byas pa tshad med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: As stated, the special development of the latent impressions that bring about the attainment of the pleasant fruition of karmic maturation should be known as immeasurable wholesome actions.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i bag chags brtas pa'i khyad par du 'gro ba dag ni dge ba rgyun rgyas pa tshad med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i bag chags brtas pa'i khyad par du 'gro ba dag ni dge ba rgyun rgyas pa tshad med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The special development of the latent impressions that bring about the attainment of the fruition of faith and so on, which is the natural outflow of virtuous dharmas, should be known as immeasurable wholesome actions.

original: rgyun rgyas pa yang rgyun 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun rgyas pa yang rgyun 'phel ba'o //

original: de rgyun rgyas pa yang zhes bya ba ni bag chags de gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: de rgyun rgyas pa yang zhes bya ba ni bag chags de gnyis nyid do //

original: de gnyis kyi khams brtas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams dang / de rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dge ba yang dag pa'i lta ba de gnyis kyi sa bon brtas pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi khams brtas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams dang / de rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dge ba yang dag pa'i lta ba de gnyis kyi sa bon brtas pa'o //
translated: The increase of the element of those two refers to the increase of the seeds of both the merit that arises from generosity and the virtue that causes it to function, which is right view.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba thams cad dge ba yin na dge ba yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes dge ba smos pa ni dge ba rgyun rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dang 'dra ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba thams cad dge ba yin na dge ba yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes dge ba smos pa ni dge ba rgyun rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dang 'dra ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If right view is virtuous, then the statement that right view is virtuous is similar to the statement the continuum of virtue is extensive.

original: ji ltar na de'i de gnyis kyi khams brtas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i de gnyis kyi khams brtas pa yin zhe na /

original: yon gnas kyi khyad par gyis sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su spyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon gnas kyi khyad par gyis sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su spyad pa'i phyir ro //

original: de gnyis kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsod nams rgyun rgyas pa dang / dge ba rgyun rgyas pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu'i sa bon brtas pa ni bde ba 'dren pa yin te /

original: 'dis 'dren par byed pas 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'dren par byed pas 'dren pa ste /

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams rgyun rgyas pa 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams rgyun rgyas pa 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pas so //

analyzed: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur la /

original: snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba yang shes pa dang mthong bas nyams su myong bar byed pa dang / rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro //üîΩri la yang @186b thad dkar 'gro /
analyzed: snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba yang shes pa dang mthong bas nyams su myong bar byed pa dang / rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro // ri la yang @186b thad dkar 'gro /

original: rab la yang thad kar 'gro ste /
analyzed: rab la yang thad kar 'gro ste /

original: lus kyis mi thogs par 'gro la //
analyzed: lus kyis mi thogs par 'gro la //

analyzed: sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang byi'u zul byed de / dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no //

analyzed: kun du nyug par byed do //

translated: This is the passage from the sutra.üîΩHe demonstrates the experience of the many kinds of supernormal knowledge.üîΩHe demonstrates the experience of the many kinds of supernormal knowledge, i.e., the many kinds of supernormal power.

analyzed: de rgyas par byed pa dang sdud pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul rgyas par byed pa dang sdud pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

original: gcig tu gyur dus mang por 'gyur mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur la zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur dus mang por 'gyur mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur la zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //

original: re zhig 'di ni dbang rnam pa dang po'o //

analyzed: lus snang bar byed pa dang / snang bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snang bar byed pa'i phyir dang / snang bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: tshig gang gis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gang gis bstan zhe na /

analyzed: ril yang tha dkar 'gro / rab la yang tha dkar 'gro ste zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // bla dang 'og la ni sa @187a * //

analyzed: la yang steng du 'byung ba dang byi'u zul byed de zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ni dbang rnam pa bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: 'di gnyi ga bsdus nas dbang rnam pa lnga ba'o //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du sems can rnams la lus kyis dbang bsgyur ro zhes gsungs pas ni khams khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas su rang gi lus 'jug pa la dbang ba bstan to //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten ni lha'i 'gro bar 'gro ba'i phyir khams kyi khyad par du dbye ste /

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro / ri la yang thad kar 'gro /
translated: ‚Äúhe goes straight through walls‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúhe goes straight through mountains‚Äù

analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //

translated: The perishing aggregates are the five aggregates of clinging.üîΩThe mind enters into that, etc.üîΩOne should understand that the mind enters into that nirvana without fear.üîΩIt is said that the mind enters into that nirvana without fear.

analyzed: de la rab tu 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'on kyang bdag 'du byed thams cad zhi bar gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid du dmigs pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems 'jug par mi byed /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag 'du byed thams cad zhi bar gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid du dmigs pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems 'jug par mi byed /
translated: ‚ÄúI do not engage my mind in the pacification of all formations, the observation of emptiness, the exhaustion of craving, freedom from attachment, cessation, and nirvana, nor do I have faith in them.

original: dad par mi byed do zhes 'byung pa'o //
analyzed: dad par mi byed do zhes 'byung pa'o //
translated: They do not have faith.üîΩ

original: de la thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that he does not have the wisdom derived from hearing and reflection.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know?

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan bdag kyang zhes rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan bdag kyang zhes rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the elder Ananda said:üîΩ‚ÄúI do not engage my mind in the pacification of all formations, the observation of emptiness, the exhaustion of craving, freedom from attachment, cessation, and nirvana, nor do I have faith in them.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gsungs pa de kho na'i phyir mang du thos pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa de kho na'i phyir mang du thos pa nyid yin te /
translated: He is called ‚Äúlearned‚Äù because he has that wisdom.

original: mang du thos pa nyid kyi phyir ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //üîΩrgyud yongs su smin pa nyid kyi phyir ni gnyis ka yang yod de /
analyzed: mang du thos pa nyid kyi phyir ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo // rgyud yongs su smin pa nyid kyi phyir ni gnyis ka yang yod de /
translated: The wisdom born of hearing is due to the fact that he has heard much.üîΩThe wisdom born of meditation is due to the fact that he has meditated much.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab med par ni rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab med par ni rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: The wisdom born of the maturation of his continuum is due to the fact that he has both heard and meditated much.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ni mjug sdud par mdzad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ni mjug sdud par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, he concludes with this verse.

original: bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par kun du rgyu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par kun du rgyu ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they proceed with and without obstacles.

original: bar chad dang bcas pa ni rgyun ring du bar chad pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad dang bcas pa ni rgyun ring du bar chad pa'o //
translated: They proceed with obstacles when they proceed for a long time with obstacles.

original: bar chad med ba ni yun thung ngur bar chad pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med ba ni yun thung ngur bar chad pa'o //
translated: They proceed without obstacles when they proceed for a short time without obstacles.üîΩBecause of that, he says:

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de nyid kyi phyir yid phyir @188a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de nyid kyi phyir yid phyir @188a * //
translated: Because of that, the bodhisattva who has attained the stage of action in accordance with conviction is said to have entered the first generation of the will to enlightenment, and is said to have attained the first generation of the will to enlightenment.

original: ldog ste / 'di ltar nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rags pa bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med pa kun du rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog ste / 'di ltar nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rags pa bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med pa kun du rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: On the contrary, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is gross, is interrupted, and is in motion without interruption.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa las yid phyir ldog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa las yid phyir ldog go //
translated: For this very reason, the mind turns away from nirvana.

original: yid nyid yid do //
analyzed: yid nyid yid do //
translated: The mind itself is the mind.

original: yongs su yi chad pa'i rgyus te yongs su yi 'chad pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yid bde ba'i rnam pa 'byung gi / yid mi bde ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su yi chad pa'i rgyus te yongs su yi 'chad pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yid bde ba'i rnam pa 'byung gi / yid mi bde ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Because of the cause of complete despair, complete despair arises in those who are free from attachment to the desire realm, in the aspect of mental pleasure, not in the aspect of mental pain.

original: de'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free from attachment to that realm.

original: yongs su yi chad pa'i rgyus ni brten nas te /
analyzed: yongs su yi chad pa'i rgyus ni brten nas te /
translated: Because of the cause of complete despair, it is based on that.

original: de'i rgyu las byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It arises from that cause, is the meaning.

original: ji ltar yid phyir ldog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid phyir ldog ce na /
translated: How does the mind turn away?

original: 'o na da nga'i bdag gang yin snyam du'o //
analyzed: 'o na da nga'i bdag gang yin snyam du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNow, what is my self?‚Äù

original: de la mi skrag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gyi sogs pa'i sgras ni mngon par dga' ba dang / rtse gcig pa nyid dang / ma chags par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi skrag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gyi sogs pa'i sgras ni mngon par dga' ba dang / rtse gcig pa nyid dang / ma chags par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is endowed with non-fear, etc. The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes: delight, one-pointedness, and non-attachment.

original: dge slong dag 'di la mig gi dbang po bsrung ba'i phyir dang / sba ba'i phyir dang / dul bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la mig gi dbang po bsrung ba'i phyir dang / sba ba'i phyir dang / dul bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Monks, in this regard, one practices in order to guard, protect, and abide in self-control with regard to the eye faculty.

original: yid kyi dbang po'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: The same applies up to the mind faculty. This is a passage from a sutra.

original: ji ltar na go rims bzhin du zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na go rims bzhin du zhe na /
translated: How is it in the same order?

original: dran pa la brten nas mig gi dbang po bsrung ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa la brten nas mig gi dbang po bsrung ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: One practices in order to guard the eye faculty by relying on mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas sba ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas sba ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: One practices in order to protect by relying on concentration.

original: shes rab la brten nas dul bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la brten nas dul bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: One practices in order to abide in self-control by relying on wisdom.

original: dul ba nyid dul bar gnas pa ste zhi gnas bzhin no //
analyzed: dul ba nyid dul bar gnas pa ste zhi gnas bzhin no //
translated: Self-control is the same as self-control, like tranquility.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba ni yul gang la mig gi dbang po de 'jug par bya ba'i yul de la bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin te dran pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba ni yul gang la mig gi dbang po de 'jug par bya ba'i yul de la bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin te dran pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the extensive passage beginning with ‚Äúit is engaged in guarding‚Äù means that it is engaged in guarding the object field in relation to which the eye faculty is engaged, because it is empowered by mindfulness.üîΩIt is engaged in protecting the object field in relation to which the eye faculty is not engaged.

original: yul gang la mig gi dbang po de 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa de la ni sba ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gang la mig gi dbang po de 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa de la ni sba ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin te /
translated: It is engaged in not engaging that object field, because the eye faculty is not engaged in that object field.

original: de mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po de mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste dran pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po de mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste dran pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that it is engaged in not engaging that object field because the eye faculty is not engaged in that object field, because it is empowered by mindfulness.

original: de'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa kun du rgyu ba'i ni mig gi sgo de nas kun du rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa kun du rgyu ba'i ni mig gi sgo de nas kun du rgyu ba ste /
translated: It is engaged in the movement of the mental afflictions through that door, because the mental afflictions move through that door of the eye.

original: de'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa kun du rgyu ba de ni de'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa kun du rgyu ba'i bag la nyal yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa kun du rgyu ba de ni de'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa kun du rgyu ba'i bag la nyal yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: and by that means, he also conquers the latent impressions of the defilements that are in the process of being abandoned.

original: dge slong @188b dag dbang po drug po 'di dag shin tu dul ba dang / shin tu spas pa dang / shin tu bsrungs pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / shin tu bsgoms pa ni phyi ma la bde ba 'dren pa yin no /
analyzed: dge slong @188b dag dbang po drug po 'di dag shin tu dul ba dang / shin tu spas pa dang / shin tu bsrungs pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / shin tu bsgoms pa ni phyi ma la bde ba 'dren pa yin no /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, these six faculties, when well-subdued, well-developed, well-propelled, well-concentrated, and well-liberated, lead to happiness in the future.

original: drug po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: drug po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the six?üîΩThe faculty of the eye, the faculty of the ear, the faculty of the nose, the faculty of the tongue, the faculty of the body, and the faculty of the mind.

original: mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin nyid kyis te /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin nyid kyis te /
translated: By means of mindfulness and introspection.

original: shes bzhin ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni shes rab bo //
translated: Introspection is wisdom.

original: de ltar na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis sems dul ba yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis sems dul ba yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, as it has been taught, the word ‚Äúwell-subdued‚Äù indicates the subjugation of the mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig gi dbang po sems kun du rgyu ba dul bar byed pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dag ni shin tu dul ba yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po sems kun du rgyu ba dul bar byed pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dag ni shin tu dul ba yin no //
translated: The eye faculty, etc. are well-controlled because they control the mind that is their universal instigator.

original: shin tu spas pa dang zhes bya ba'i tshig de la sogs pa rnams kyis ni sems dul ba'i thabs yongs su bstan ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu spas pa dang zhes bya ba'i tshig de la sogs pa rnams kyis ni sems dul ba'i thabs yongs su bstan ba yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúwell-subdued‚Äù and so on indicate the means of controlling the mind.

original: 'di yang smras pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dran pas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa'i phyir na spas pa yin no //üîΩshes bzhin gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes pa las te byung ba las bsrungs pa yin no //üîΩgnon dang rtsa ba bcom gnyis kyis //üîΩbsdams dang bsgoms pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'di yang smras pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dran pas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa'i phyir na spas pa yin no // shes bzhin gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes pa las te byung ba las bsrungs pa yin no // gnon dang rtsa ba bcom gnyis kyis // bsdams dang bsgoms pa yin par 'dod //
translated: This is also said in detail: ‚ÄúIt is well-subdued by mindfulness because it does not generate the envelopments of the defilements.üîΩIt is well-controlled by vigilance because it guards against the arising of the envelopments of the defilements that have arisen.

original: rnam par gnon pas ni shin tu bsdams pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pas ni shin tu bsdams pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is well-tamed by the path of cultivation because it destroys the roots of the envelopments of the defilements.üîΩIt is well-concentrated by the path of no-more-learning because it is the basis of the super-knowledges.

original: rnam par gnon pa yang 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa yang 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: It is well-mastered by the worldly path of cultivation.

original: rtsa ba bcom pas shin tu bsgoms pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: rtsa ba bcom pas shin tu bsgoms pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is well cultivated because its root is destroyed.

original: rtsa ba ni bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni bag la nyal lo //
translated: The root is the latent tendency.

original: rtsa ba bcom pa yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis so //üîΩlung las ni 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtsa ba bcom pa yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis so // lung las ni 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: And the root is destroyed by the supramundane path.üîΩIn the scriptures, it is said that the eye faculty is well guarded because it does not engage in what should not be engaged in.

original: 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang la mig gi dbang po de 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa de la mi 'jug ba'i phyir shin tu spas pa yin no //üîΩ'jug par bya ba la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pas 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang la mig gi dbang po de 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa de la mi 'jug ba'i phyir shin tu spas pa yin no // 'jug par bya ba la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pas 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is well guarded because the eye faculty does not engage in things that should not be engaged in.üîΩIt is well cultivated because it engages in what should be engaged in with mindfulness well-established.

original: 'jug par bya ba'i dngos po la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pas 'jug pa'i phyir de shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba'i dngos po la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pas 'jug pa'i phyir de shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: It is well cultivated because it engages in things that should be engaged in with mindfulness well-established.

original: rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbang gis mig gi dbang po de zhugs na yang chags par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbang gis mig gi dbang po de zhugs na yang chags par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It is well cultivated because it does not itself become defiled. This is the meaning: even when the eye faculty engages, it does not become defiled by attachment or aversion.

original: zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /üîΩso sor @189a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te / so sor @189a * //
translated: because one does not become emotionally involved with things that arouse anger.

original: rtog pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the power of discernment.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kho nas te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kho nas te /
translated: It is by the power of meditation.üîΩThus, it is well cultivated.

original: de ltar na de shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is well subdued.

original: de ltar na shin tu dul ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung bas mig gi dbang po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu dul ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung bas mig gi dbang po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is well subdued, as stated in the sutra.

original: shin tu dul ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is well subdued.üîΩIt is a loving mind, a mind without enmity,üîΩa mind without rivalry,

analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa / 'gran zla med pa /
translated: a mind without harm,üîΩa vast mind, an extensive mind,üîΩan immeasurable mind,üîΩan unafflicted mind,üîΩan unafflicted and unconstricted mind,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,üîΩa mind free from disputation,üîΩa mind free from attachment,üîΩa mind free from hatred,üîΩa mind free from delusion,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,üîΩa mind free from disputation,

analyzed: gnod pa med pa / yangs pa rgya chen por gyur pa /
translated: a mind free from attachment,üîΩa mind free from hatred,üîΩa mind free from delusion,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,üîΩa mind free from disputation,üîΩa mind free from attachment,üîΩa mind free from hatred,üîΩa mind free from delusion,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,üîΩa mind free from disputation,üîΩa mind free from attachment,üîΩa mind free from hatred,üîΩa mind free from delusion,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,üîΩa mind free from disputation,üîΩa mind free from attachment,üîΩa mind free from hatred,üîΩa mind free from delusion,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,

original: tshad med pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa /
translated: a mind free from disputation,üîΩa mind free from attachment,üîΩa mind free from hatred,üîΩa mind free from delusion,üîΩa mind free from anger,üîΩa mind free from violence,üîΩa mind free from hostility,üîΩa mind free from contention,üîΩa mind free from dis

original: shin tu bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu smos te khyab par byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu smos te khyab par byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: The phrase he dwells having thoroughly pervaded, made it his own, and made it a living experience in one direction with his thought of loving-kindness that is cultivated, made great, and is well-developed is the section of the sutra.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i bsam pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o bsam pa ni sems pa ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i bsam pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o bsam pa ni sems pa ste /
translated: The phrase the thought of loving-kindness is a thought of beneficence and a thought of happiness means that the thought of loving-kindness is a thought of beneficence and a thought of happiness.

original: zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The thought of loving-kindness is the absence of hatred.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase he dwells should be connected with the thought of loving-kindness.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir khon med pa dang / 'gran zla med pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir khon med pa dang / 'gran zla med pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: The phrase he dwells with a thought of loving-kindness that is free of enmity, free of malice, and free of rivalry indicates that it is the antidote to the three types of secondary mental afflictions.

original: khon du 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir khon med pa'o //üîΩphrag dog gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir 'gran zla med pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir khon med pa'o // phrag dog gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir 'gran zla med pa'o //
translated: It is free of enmity because it is the antidote to enmity.üîΩIt is free of rivalry because it is the antidote to jealousy.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is free of malice because it is the antidote to hatred.

original: gnod pa byed pa dag la khon du 'dzin pa zhes pa ni gnod pa byed pa dag la kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po lan mang du byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgnod pa mi byed pa dag la phrag dog ces bya ba ni sems can mnyam pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa gnod pa mi byed pa de dag la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa dag la khon du 'dzin pa zhes pa ni gnod pa byed pa dag la kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po lan mang du byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gnod pa mi byed pa dag la phrag dog ces bya ba ni sems can mnyam pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa gnod pa mi byed pa de dag la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Holding a grudge against those who harm you means to repeatedly harbor resentment against those who harm you.üîΩJealousy means to be inwardly disturbed by those who are equal or superior to you and who do not harm you.üîΩHatred is the hatred that arises from the two, i.e., from those who harm you and those who do not harm you, and which is directed toward those who are inferior to you.

original: de nyid dang ldan ba'i dman pa dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems can gnod pa byed pa dang gnod pa mi byed pa de gnyis dang ldan pa dman pa dag la zhe sdang gang gis na de gnyis dang ldan pa dman paüîΩde dag la gnod par 'gyur ba'i zhe sdang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang ldan ba'i dman pa dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems can gnod pa byed pa dang gnod pa mi byed pa de gnyis dang ldan pa dman pa dag la zhe sdang gang gis na de gnyis dang ldan pa dman paüîΩde dag la gnod par 'gyur ba'i zhe sdang yin no //
translated: Hatred is the hatred that arises from the two, i.e., from those who harm you and those who do not harm you, and which is directed toward those who are inferior to you.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu thul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu thul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po yin no //
translated: The opposing side is the three kinds of secondary defilement.

original: de ltar na zhas bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar bstan pa de ltar na byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems de @189b gnyen po nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhas bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar bstan pa de ltar na byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems de @189b gnyen po nyid kyis te /
translated: Thus, the mind endowed with love is an antidote, as has been taught.

original: tshig gsum po khon med pa 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pas yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gsum po khon med pa 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pas yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the three phrases: without hostility, without rivalry, and without harm.

original: sems de 'bras bu nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sems de 'bras bu nyid kyis te /
translated: The mind endowed with love is a result,

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: taught by the phrase: extensive.

original: sems de gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: sems de gnyis kyis te /
translated: The mind endowed with love is both of these,

original: rgya chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: taught by the phrase: become great.

original: sems de dmigs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sems de dmigs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The mind endowed with love is an objective support,

original: tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: taught by the phrase: immeasurable.

original: sems de rnam par dag pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sems de rnam par dag pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The mind endowed with love is pure,üîΩtaught by the phrase: purified.

original: shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is indicated by the expression ‚Äúvery well cultivated.‚Äù

original: gnas kyis gnas pa po bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyis sems can rnams ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas kyis gnas pa po bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyis sems can rnams ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the basis, the one who is situated is indicated‚Äù means that sentient beings are indicated by means of the direction.

original: dper na khri dga' bod do //
analyzed: dper na khri dga' bod do //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthe seats are crying out,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúthe mountains are burning.‚Äù

original: ri dag tshig go zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni khri'i steng na 'dug pa'i mi dag 'bod pa dang / ri'i steng na 'dug pa dag mes tshig pa yin no //
analyzed: ri dag tshig go zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni khri'i steng na 'dug pa'i mi dag 'bod pa dang / ri'i steng na 'dug pa dag mes tshig pa yin no //
translated: The people who are sitting on the seats are crying out, and those who are sitting on the mountains are burning.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa nyid ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa nyid ston pa yin gyi /
translated: It shows only the attention of aspiration,

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not the attention of reality.

original: cig car du mtha' dag la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mnyam du sems can thams cad la smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cig car du mtha' dag la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mnyam du sems can thams cad la smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of simultaneous aspiration for the totality means because of simultaneous aspiration for all sentient beings.

original: de ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni byams pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni byams pa ston pa yin no //
translated: It shows that means it shows love.

original: dus gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yun thung ngur ma yin gyi dus yun ring por rjes su 'jug par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yun thung ngur ma yin gyi dus yun ring por rjes su 'jug par ston pa yin no //
translated: It shows that he will follow them for a long time, not just for a short time.

original: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba na brtson 'grus brtsams zhing zhum pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba na brtson 'grus brtsams zhing zhum pa med pa yin /
translated: When he knows and sees in this way, he is energetic and not lazy.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin /
translated: His body is well cultivated and free from faults.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing kun du rmongs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing kun du rmongs pa med pa yin /
translated: He is mindful and not confused.üîΩHis mind is concentrated and one-pointed.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig pa yin zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig pa yin zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the section of the sutra.

original: tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi ma zhum pa med pa yin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis tshig bzhi po brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa ni
analyzed: tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi ma zhum pa med pa yin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis tshig bzhi po brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa ni
translated: The following words are explained. The following words, beginning with ‚Äúnot lazy,‚Äù explain the four words ‚Äúhe is energetic‚Äù and so on.

original: tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The second phrase is the explanation.

original: ji ltar na go rims bzhin du yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na go rims bzhin du yin zhe na /
translated: How are they in order?

original: sems ha cang zhum pa'i gnyen por brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhum pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa 'di yin no //üîΩha cang rab tu bzung @190a * //
analyzed: sems ha cang zhum pa'i gnyen por brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhum pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa 'di yin no // ha cang rab tu bzung @190a * //
translated: The antidote to excessive contraction of the mind is the absence of contraction, the exertion of vigor.

original: ba'i gnyen por lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ba'i gnyen por lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The antidote to excessive tension is the absence of misbehavior, the pliancy of the body.

original: nyes par brtsams pa med pa nyid kyang lus ma nyen zhing lus las su rung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par brtsams pa med pa nyid kyang lus ma nyen zhing lus las su rung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of misbehavior should be understood as the serviceability and non-exhaustion of the body.

original: nang du bsdus pa zhes bya ba 'di ni drin pa nye bar gzhag cing kun du rmongs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: nang du bsdus pa zhes bya ba 'di ni drin pa nye bar gzhag cing kun du rmongs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: The internal withdrawal is the absence of confusion, the establishment of mindfulness.

original: phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig pa yin zhes bya ba'i tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig pa yin zhes bya ba'i tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa 'di yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistracted outwardly‚Äù is explained by the second phrase ‚Äúthe mind is not concentrated and one-pointed.‚ÄùüîΩThe sutra describes the characteristics of these states of excessive laxity, etc.:

original: ha cang zhum pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdo las ji ltar sems ha cang zhum pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ha cang zhum pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdo las ji ltar sems ha cang zhum pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is a mind that is excessively lax?

original: sems le lo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems le lo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: A mind that is associated with laziness.

original: ji ltar na sems ha cang rab tu bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems ha cang rab tu bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is a mind that is excessively excited?

original: sems rgod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems rgod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that is associated with agitation.

original: ji ltar na sems nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is a mind that is internally withdrawn?

original: sems rmugs pa dang gnyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems rmugs pa dang gnyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: A mind that is associated with lethargy and sleepiness.

original: sems nang du 'gog pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sems nang du 'gog pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: A mind that is associated with cessation,

original: lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not with insight.

original: de ltar na sems nang du bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems nang du bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is a mind that is internally withdrawn.

original: ji ltar na sems phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is a mind that is distracted outwardly?

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la rjes su rnam par g-yengs pa dang rjes su 'phros pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la rjes su rnam par g-yengs pa dang rjes su 'phros pa gang yin pa de /
translated: It is distracted and scattered by the five sense objects.

original: de ltar na sems phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus it is distracted externally.

original: de kho na'i zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems rnam pa bzhi po de kho na'i gnyen po song ba'i 'du byed rnam pa gnyis gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de kho na'i zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems rnam pa bzhi po de kho na'i gnyen po song ba'i 'du byed rnam pa gnyis gnyis yin te /
translated: The antidote to just those four types of minds is the two types of applied practices that are their antidotes.

original: re re la yang gnyis gnyis yin pas de ltar na spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re re la yang gnyis gnyis yin pas de ltar na spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there are two for each, there are eight applied practices that abandon those four.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?üîΩThe sutras state:

original: mdo las shin tu rgyas par gsungs nas 'dun pa gang yin pa dang / rtsol ba gang yin pa dang / dad pa gang yin pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa dang / dran pa gang yin pa dang / shes bzhin gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: mdo las shin tu rgyas par gsungs nas 'dun pa gang yin pa dang / rtsol ba gang yin pa dang / dad pa gang yin pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa dang / dran pa gang yin pa dang / shes bzhin gang yin pa dang /
translated: Aspiration, effort, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance,

original: sems pa gang yin pa dang / btang snyoms gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa gang yin pa dang / btang snyoms gang yin pa ste /
translated: intention and equanimity.

original: 'di dag spong pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag spong pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: These are called the formative forces that abandon those.

original: de la ha cang zhum pa'i gnyen por ni 'dun pa dang rtsol ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de la ha cang zhum pa'i gnyen por ni 'dun pa dang rtsol ba gnyis te /
translated: Among them, the two, aspiration and effort, are the antidote for excessive laxity.

original: le lo'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the antidote for laziness.üîΩFaith and pliancy are the antidote for excessive tautness.

original: ha cang rab tu bzung ba'i ni dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yin te dad pa yod na shin tu sbyangs pa gnyen bor 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ha cang rab tu bzung ba'i ni dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yin te dad pa yod na shin tu sbyangs pa gnyen bor 'gyur bas so //
translated: When there is faith, pliancy is the antidote.

original: nang du @190b bsdus pa'i ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin gnyis te /
analyzed: nang du @190b bsdus pa'i ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin gnyis te /
translated: The two, mindfulness and introspection, are the antidote for excessive internal contraction.

original: de gnyis kyis ni rmugs pa dang gnyid du yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni rmugs pa dang gnyid du yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: By those two, one does not become dull or sleepy,

original: lhag mthong yang nye bar gnas par byed do //
analyzed: lhag mthong yang nye bar gnas par byed do //
translated: and insight is maintained.

original: phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa'i gnyen por ni sems pa dang / btang snyoms yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa'i gnyen por ni sems pa dang / btang snyoms yin no //
translated: The two, intention and equanimity, are the antidote for external distraction.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How are they antidotes?

original: sems pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa yin te /
translated: Intention is the formative force.

original: lus 'di nyid rkang mthil nas spyi bo dang / skra dang / klad pa nas 'og tu pags pa la thug par mi gtsang pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang bar so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: lus 'di nyid rkang mthil nas spyi bo dang / skra dang / klad pa nas 'og tu pags pa la thug par mi gtsang pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang bar so sor rtog ste /
translated: He contemplates this very body from the soles of the feet up to the top of the head, and from the hair, head, and nails down to the skin, as filled with various kinds of filth.

original: lus 'di la skra dang / spu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lus 'di la skra dang / spu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This body is full of hair of the head, hair of the body, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, marrow, kidney, heart, liver, serum, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, stomach, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, nasal mucus, synovial fluid, and urine.

original: de nas 'du byed de dag la btang snyoms kyis btang snyoms su byed do //üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sems rnam par g-yeng zhing rnam par ma zhi la rgod par gyur pa na dmigs pa la byed pa med pa nyid dang / zhi bar 'gyur ba nyid dang /
analyzed: de nas 'du byed de dag la btang snyoms kyis btang snyoms su byed do // gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sems rnam par g-yeng zhing rnam par ma zhi la rgod par gyur pa na dmigs pa la byed pa med pa nyid dang / zhi bar 'gyur ba nyid dang /
translated: Then, he becomes indifferent to those formative forces through equanimity.üîΩMoreover, when the mind is distracted by discursive thought, and is not calm and serene, in the state of meditative concentration, he becomes indifferent to those formative forces through equanimity.üîΩTranquility is the absence of activity with regard to the objective support, the absence of agitation with regard to the mind, and the absence of discursive thought with regard to the body.

original: lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba ni zhi gnas so //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba ni zhi gnas so //
translated: Tranquility is the absence of activity with regard to the objective support, the absence of agitation with regard to the mind, and the absence of discursive thought with regard to the body.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa ni zhum par 'gro ba na mchog tu dga' ba'i gzhi la dmigs pas de la sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa ni zhum par 'gro ba na mchog tu dga' ba'i gzhi la dmigs pas de la sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the basis for the highest delight when the mind is slack.

original: de nyid kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por tshig nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por tshig nyid yin te /
translated: And that is the antidote to the secondary defilement of laziness.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhum pa med pa yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhum pa med pa yin /
translated: He is energetic, not fainthearted.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis so //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis so //
translated: He is physically fit, not prone to error.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: go rims bzhin du zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir la zhum pa dang rgod pa de gnyis kyang zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa kho na'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir la zhum pa dang rgod pa de gnyis kyang zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa kho na'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pas so //
translated: Because they are, respectively, the antidotes to faintheartedness and excitedness. And those two, faintheartedness and excitedness, are the secondary defilements of calm and insight.

original: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis na tshogs de ha cang zhan par 'gyur ba'i sems las byung ba'i chas 'ga' zhig yod pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis na tshogs de ha cang zhan par 'gyur ba'i sems las byung ba'i chas 'ga' zhig yod pa yin pa'o //
translated: Faintheartedness is a certain mental factor by which the collection of mind and mental functions becomes weak.

original: de bzhin du rgod pa yang gang gis na rgod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgod pa yang gang gis na rgod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Similarly, excitedness is a certain mental factor by which the mind becomes excited.

original: btang snyoms kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por yang tshig gnyis yin te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por yang tshig gnyis yin te /
translated: Two phrases are the antidote to the secondary defilement of indifference.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing kun du rmongs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing kun du rmongs pa med pa yin /
translated: He is mindful and not confused.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dag go //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dag go //

original: gang gi phyir brtson 'grus ma brtsams na sems zhu ma par 'gyur ba nas sems nyams pa'i bar de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen po nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ni sems zhum pa dang / lus dub pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang /

analyzed: sha'i mig ni rnam par dag pa ma mthong ba'i phyir rnyog pa can no zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par du byed pa ni sha'i mig dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //

original: bden pa rnams @191b la ngan par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa la dmigs pa dang / log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa na mig skyes shing /

analyzed: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin te /

analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig de ni don mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir log par lta ba'i gnyen po yin no //

original: de nyid the tshom med pa'i phyir shes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid the tshom med pa'i phyir shes pa ste /

original: the tshom gyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnyen po yin no //

original: de nyid yang dag par don du gyur pa'i phyir rig pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid yang dag par don du gyur pa'i phyir rig pa ste /

original: ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin no //üîΩbzlas pa gsum dag la thog mar mthong ba ni mig go zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba nas /

translated: It is the antidote to ignorance.üîΩThe three repetitions: First seeing is eye.üîΩFirst seeing is the path of seeing, that is, the knowledge that this is the truth of suffering of the aryas, up to the knowledge that this is the truth of the path of the aryas that is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar thog mar mthong ba gang yin pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //

original: mngon par shes pas yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i bar thog mar mthong ba gang yin pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gang yin pa la sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa de bdag gis mngon par shes pas yongs su shes so zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag gis mngon par shes pas bsgoms so zhes byaüîΩba'i bar thog mar mthong ba gang yin pa ste /

translated: The first seeing of the noble truth of suffering is to be fully understood by higher perception and so on, up to the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering is to be cultivated by higher perception.

original: bslab pa gsum po 'di dag la thog mar mthong ba 'di ni mig go //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po 'di dag la thog mar mthong ba 'di ni mig go //

original: ji ltar mthong ba la rnam par dpyod pa ni shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni lam gsum po 'di dag la sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ji ltar mthong ba rnams la rnam par 'jog pa'i ye shes dang / rnam par mi 'jog pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob par rang dang spyi'i mtshan @192a * //

translated: Knowledge is the knowledge that establishes the four noble truths such as suffering, etc., as they are seen in these three paths, and the knowledge that does not establish them, which is transcendent and subsequently attained.

original: nyid gnyis su rnam par dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: nyid gnyis su rnam par dpyod pa ste /
translated: It is the analysis of the two realities, the reality of particulars and the reality of generalities.

original: so sor rtog pa ni shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni shes pa zhes bya'o //

original: de yang zag pa med pa'i ye shes yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang zag pa med pa'i ye shes yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: de la zag pa rgyas par mi 'gyur bas so //

original: de yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /

original: lam gsum char la yang thog mar rnam par mi 'jog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa skye la /
analyzed: lam gsum char la yang thog mar rnam par mi 'jog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa skye la /

analyzed: de nas de'i rjes la rnam par 'jog pa skye'o //

translated: The detailed classification of these two kinds of knowledge, which is not a mode and which is a mode, should be understood from the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi.

analyzed: gnyis po de nyid kyis bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig dang shes pa gnyis po de nyid do //

analyzed: dngos po ji snyed pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di la yod pas de ni ji snyed yod pa can no //

original: de'i dngos po de ni ji snyed yod pa can nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po de ni ji snyed yod pa can nyid de /
