original: de la ni ji snyed yod pa can nyid la brten nas te /
analyzed: de la ni ji snyed yod pa can nyid la brten nas te /
translated: It is based on just that many things.

original: brtan pa nas de la dmigs par byed pa na gnyis po de rig pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa nas de la dmigs par byed pa na gnyis po de rig pa'o //
translated: When one is made to perceive that, one knows those two.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ji snyed yod pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de kun 'byung ba dang / de 'gog pa dang / de'i lam ji snyed yod pa de 'dzin pas de'i phyir de gnyis ka rig pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar yod pa can nyid la brten nas blo ste /

translated: The existence of suffering, etc., in whatever form is the way they exist.üîΩThat which has the four noble truths as its object is the one who has the way they exist as its object.

original: de la ni ji ltar yod pa can nyid la brten nas te /
analyzed: de la ni ji ltar yod pa can nyid la brten nas te /
translated: The nature of that is the way they exist as its object.üîΩThe intellect is dependent on that.

original: de la dmigs par byed pa na de gnyis ka blo'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa na de gnyis ka blo'o //
translated: When it has that as its object, it is the intellect of both.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the understanding of reality just as it is.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos ma thos pa rnams la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa med pas rjes su dpag pa can yin no snyam du sems na de rjes su dpag pa can ma yin pas /

analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir mig ces bya ba gsungs so //

analyzed: ji ltar mi sdug pa bsgoms pa na rus pa dang rus gong du mos pa'i phyir mos pa yid la byed pas rus pa dang rus gong rnams kyis sa gang bar mthong ba lta bu yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir mos pa las byung ba'i mthong
translated: If you think that if the eye does not arise from hearing,üîΩit is not an inference, and it is not a vision that arises from aspiration, then it is a vision that arises from the ripening of karma.

original: ba dgag pa'i phyir shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so//
analyzed: ba dgag pa'i phyir shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so//
translated: In order to refute that, he says: ‚Äúit is knowledge.‚Äù

original: gal te de thos pa las byung ba yang ma yin /

analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bzod pa ni mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mig yin la zhes bya ba de ni'o //

analyzed: bzlas pa gsum dag la 'thad pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam la yang bzod pa med pa ma yin pas so //

original: dge slong dag 'di ni khyod la phan pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni bde ba'i phyir dang / 'di ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni khyod la phan pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni bde ba'i phyir dang / 'di ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //

translated: The application of one who is exhausted is the application of one who is exhausted.

original: bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la rjes su sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la rjes su sbyor ba ste /
translated: The suffering that arises from tormenting oneself, from tormenting others, and from tormenting oneself and others, such as through the practice of plucking out the hair, etc., is the application of one who is exhausted.üîΩThe application of one who is exhausted is the application of one who is exhausted.

original: rjes su 'jug pa ni bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i rjes su sbyor ba'o //üîΩgnyi ga'i mtha' spangs nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' @193a * //

translated: The application of one who is exhausted is the application of one who is exhausted.üîΩHaving abandoned both extremes, he cultivates the middle way.

original: dang / bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i rjes su sbyor pa'i mtha' spangs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang / bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i rjes su sbyor pa'i mtha' spangs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having abandoned the extreme of the application of indulgence in sensual pleasure and the extreme of the application of exhausting oneself, he cultivates the middle way.

original: dbu ma'i lam bsgoms pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam bsgoms pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /

original: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: This is the middle way.

original: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa ste /
translated: Moreover, for the sake of benefit, one relies on the antidote to the secondary defilement that is associated with suffering.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags shas che ba rnams so sor brtags shing tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags shas che ba rnams so sor brtags shing tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa lta bu'o //

original: bde ba'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa rnams med par sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bsten pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa rnams med par sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bsten pa yin te /
translated: For the sake of happiness, one relies on the antidote to suffering without the afflictions.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it says in a sutra:

original: brnab sems kyis sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bdag nyid la gnod par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: brnab sems kyis sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bdag nyid la gnod par yang mi 'gyur la /

original: chos kyis rnyed pa'i bde ba yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyis rnyed pa'i bde ba yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni bde ba dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa yin te /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni bde ba dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa yin te /
translated: For the sake of benefit and happiness, one relies on the antidote to the affliction that is associated with happiness.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags chung ba rnams tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags chung ba rnams tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, those with little attachment rely on the practice of celibacy.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams ma gtogs pa mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam mo //

translated: Moreover, the path of eliminating the defilements is based on the preliminary stage, except for the abiding in comfort in this life of higher thought.

original: de dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi rnams so //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i lam ma gtogs pa'o // lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la brten sa nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba de'i tshe nyon mongs pa spong ba zad pa'i lam de dag phan pa

original: dang bde ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: dang bde ba'i phyir yin no //

translated: Moreover, the path of those in training, i.e., stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, is difficult because it is slow.

original: de yang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i lam ste /

original: ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par sbyar ro //

original: dka' ba yang yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba yang yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zhi gnas ma tshang ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can @193b gnyis so //

original: lhag mthong mtshang ba ni gzugs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag mthong mtshang ba ni gzugs med pa rnams so //

original: bde ba'i phyir ni mi slob pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ni mi slob pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam ste /

original: dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i lam mo //

analyzed: sla ba yang yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa gnyis kyis 'bad pa med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi lam de ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir sla ba ma yin no //

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni slob pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni slob pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam ste /

analyzed: phan pa'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: bde ba'i phyir ni dngos gzhi zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ni dngos gzhi zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan rten yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: shing thags btsugs pa ni zab ring ba /
analyzed: shing thags btsugs pa ni zab ring ba /

analyzed: kha cig las ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa la bya bar mngon te zhes bya ba ni mdo 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa la len pa med par mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar mngon te /
translated: In some sutras, it is stated, ‚ÄúOne attains nirvana without remainder of aggregates‚Äù and so on, but here it is clear that it refers to nirvana without remainder of aggregates.üîΩIn this sutra, it is clear that it refers to nirvana without remainder of aggregates, that is, nirvana without grasping.

original: phung po thams cad yongs su zad pas mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de la bya bar mngon te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phung po thams cad yongs su zad pas mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de la bya bar mngon te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is clear that it refers to nirvana that is the complete exhaustion of all aggregates.

original: ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this clear?

original: tshe phyi ma'i 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang gi phyir skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun dang tshe phyi ma ste /üîΩtshe rabs gzhan gyi 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir te / gang gi phyir skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun dang tshe phyi ma ste / tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the state of going in the next life.üîΩBecause it is the state of going in the next life,üîΩit is the state of going in other lives.

original: tshe phyi ma'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de len pa med par mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de len pa med par mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that nirvana is the state of going in the next life without taking up another existence.üîΩMoreover, this sutra states,

original: gzhan yang mdo sde 'di las shar phyogs su 'gro bar mi smra zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde 'di las shar phyogs su 'gro bar mi smra zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not say that he goes to the east,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad 'byung zhe na /
translated: What does it say?

original: shar phyogs su 'gro bar mi smra zhing /
analyzed: shar phyogs su 'gro bar mi smra zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not say that he goes to the east,

original: lho phyogs su ma yin /üîΩnub phyogs su ma yin /
analyzed: lho phyogs su ma yin / nub phyogs su ma yin /

original: byang phyogs su ma yin /üîΩsteng du ma yin /
analyzed: byang phyogs su ma yin / steng du ma yin /

original: 'og tu ma yin /
analyzed: 'og tu ma yin /

original: phyogs mtshams rnams su ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams rnams su ma yin te /

original: gzhan du na mthong ba'i chos la dri ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang / bsil bar gyur @196a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na mthong ba'i chos la dri ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang / bsil bar gyur @196a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable to explain the sutra statement:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is stainless in this life, it is nirvana, it is peace, it is sublime cooling, it is Brahma.‚Äù

analyzed: pa dang / tshangs par gyur pa yin no zhes de lta bur rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa la bya bar mngon te zhes bya bar grub bo // nga'i nyan thos kyi dge slong g-yo med pa /

original: sgyu med pa /üîΩdrang po / drang po'i rang bzhin can tshur shog dang / de ni ngas nang par gdams ngag phog na ni nub mo khyad par du 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgyu med pa / drang po / drang po'i rang bzhin can tshur shog dang / de ni ngas nang par gdams ngag phog na ni nub mo khyad par du 'gyur la /

original: yod pa la yang yod pa nyid dang / med pa la yang med pa nyid dang / bla ma dang bcas pa la yang bla ma dang bcas pa nyid dang / bla na med pa la yang bla na med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: yod pa la yang yod pa nyid dang / med pa la yang med pa nyid dang / bla ma dang bcas pa la yang bla ma dang bcas pa nyid dang / bla na med pa la yang bla na med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: One will know that what exists is just existent, and what does not exist is nonexistent, and what has a superior is not without a superior, and what is unsurpassed is unsurpassed. This is the section on sutra.

original: yod pa la yang yod pa nyid du shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po yod par shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //

translated: The unconditioned with remainder is with remainder, that is,

original: de rnams gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: @196b de de ltar shes nas smon pa med pas ni bla ma dang bcas pa la yid smon par mi byed do //
translated: Having known that way, they do not wish for what is inferior through the concentration on wishlessness.

analyzed: mtshan ma med pas ni bla na med pa la smon par byed pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa de rnams kyi go rims ni de kho na'i phyir ro //

original: med pa la ni med par shes so //

original: gang gis she na /

original: de nas de ltar shes nas /

original: ji ltar gang yod la ste /

original: 'dus ma byas pa ni bla na med pa'o //

translated: Therefore, because of that, i.e., because emptiness previously causes one to know existence as existence and non-existence as non-existence,

translated: Then, immediately after that, the two, together with the master, understand the existence of the three concentrations, emptiness and so on, because they are the antidotes to the three errors.

original: stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are the concentrations of emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness, respectively.

original: gzhan yang smras pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams ji ltar na gnyen po nyid yin pa dang / ji ltar na gsum yin pa dang go rims ji lta bu yin pa'o //

translated: Moreover, it is said: How are those concentrations of emptiness and so on antidotes? How are they three? What is their sequence?

analyzed: mdo sde'i dum bu'i tshig rnams kyi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the verses of the s≈´tra section has been explained.

original: gsum po de'i gnyen por ni //
analyzed: gsum po de'i gnyen por ni //
translated: The antidotes to those three are

original: stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin rnams //
analyzed: stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin rnams //
translated: the concentrations of emptiness and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin ba dang / srid pa la sred pa dang / sred pa zad pa mi 'dod pa de gsum gyi gnyen por stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin ba dang / srid pa la sred pa dang / sred pa zad pa mi 'dod pa de gsum gyi gnyen por stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: These three are the antidotes to the three: the grasping of a self, craving for existence, and not wanting the extinction of craving.

original: gzhan yang mdo sde'i dum bu'i tshig de rnams las ting nge 'dzin gang gis gang zhig ji ltar rig par bya ba dang / de rnams gsum nyid yin pa dang // go rims ji lta bu yin pa de smras pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde'i dum bu'i tshig de rnams las ting nge 'dzin gang gis gang zhig ji ltar rig par bya ba dang / de rnams gsum nyid yin pa dang // go rims ji lta bu yin pa de smras pa //
translated: Moreover, from among those words of the s≈´tra passages, it is said that by which samƒÅdhi what is to be known in what way, and that they are three, and what their order is.

original: gcig gis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: gcig gis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: By one, by the samƒÅdhi of emptiness.

original: yod dang med pa rig pa ni ji ltar bstan pa lta bu'o //üîΩgnyis kyis ni smon pa med pa @197a * //
analyzed: yod dang med pa rig pa ni ji ltar bstan pa lta bu'o // gnyis kyis ni smon pa med pa @197a * //
translated: The knowledge of existence and non-existence is as taught.

original: dang / mtshan ma med pas so //
analyzed: dang / mtshan ma med pas so //
translated: By two, by the wishless and the signless.

original: yod la skyon yod rig pa ni ji skad bstan ma thag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod la skyon yod rig pa ni ji skad bstan ma thag pa lta bu'o //
translated: The knowledge of the faults of existence is as just taught.

original: de'i phyir ni rgyu'i phyir gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni rgyu'i phyir gsum mo //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, they are three.

original: de dag gi rim pa ni sngar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de nas smon pa med pa dang / de nas mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni snga mas phyi ma drangs te /üîΩ'di ltar go rims ni ting nge 'dzin snga mas ting nge 'dzin phyi mas phyi mas phyi ma drangs pas so //
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa ni sngar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de nas smon pa med pa dang / de nas mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni snga mas phyi ma drangs te / 'di ltar go rims ni ting nge 'dzin snga mas ting nge 'dzin phyi mas phyi mas phyi ma drangs pas so //
translated: The order of those is that the concentration of wishlessness follows from the concentration of emptiness, and the concentration of signlessness follows from that.üîΩThus, the order is that the later concentrations are induced by the former concentrations.

original: lung las ni med dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ni med pa'i dngos po la ni bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de med pa'i dngos po de la'o //
analyzed: lung las ni med dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ni med pa'i dngos po la ni bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de med pa'i dngos po de la'o //
translated: The statement in scripture that ‚Äúthe concentration of emptiness is preceded by the concentration of wishlessness, and that is preceded by the concentration of signlessness‚Äù is not contradictory, because the concentration of wishlessness is preceded by the concentration of emptiness, and that is preceded by the concentration of signlessness.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad do //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù is a verbal particle.

original: skyon ldan gyi dngos po ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams kyis so //
analyzed: skyon ldan gyi dngos po ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams kyis so //
translated: A thing that possesses faults is impermanent, and so on.

original: yon tan ldan dngos la ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ldan dngos la ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: A thing that possesses qualities is nirvana, which possesses the qualities of being permanent, blissful, and so on.

original: dngos po rnam pa de gsum la /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa de gsum la /
translated: With regard to those three kinds of things,

original: yod 'dzin yon tan ldan 'dzin dang // yon tan mi ldan 'dzin gzhom phyir //üîΩgo rims bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so zhes 'byung ba ni med pa'i dngos po la yod par 'dzin pa gzhom pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: yod 'dzin yon tan ldan 'dzin dang // yon tan mi ldan 'dzin gzhom phyir // go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so zhes 'byung ba ni med pa'i dngos po la yod par 'dzin pa gzhom pa'i phyir ni /
translated: To destroy the apprehension of existence, the apprehension of possessing good qualities, and the apprehension of possessing no good qualities,üîΩrespectively, there are the concentrations on emptiness and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //üîΩskyon dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yon tan dang ldan par 'dzin pa gzhom pa'i phyir ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to // skyon dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yon tan dang ldan par 'dzin pa gzhom pa'i phyir ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration on emptiness is to destroy the apprehension of an existent thing that does not exist.üîΩThe concentration on wishlessness is to destroy the apprehension of possessing good qualities in a thing that possesses faults.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan par 'dzin pa gzhom pa'i phyir ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to /üîΩ// / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /üîΩbam po drug pa /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan par 'dzin pa gzhom pa'i phyir ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to /üîΩ// / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /üîΩbam po drug pa /
translated: The concentration on signlessness is to destroy the apprehension of possessing no good qualities in a thing that possesses good qualities.

original: dge slong dag gang gi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'gog pa yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de 'di ltar legs par mthong ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang gi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'gog pa yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de 'di ltar legs par mthong ba dang /
translated: Monks, because the noble disciple who is learned sees the origin of the world and the cessation of the world with right wisdom just as it is,üîΩhe is said to have seen well,üîΩto have known well, to have understood well, to have penetrated well, and to have fully seen well.

original: legs par rig pa dang / legs par yid la byas pa dang / logs par bsten pa dang / legs par rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum du yin no //
analyzed: legs par rig pa dang / legs par yid la byas pa dang / logs par bsten pa dang / legs par rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum du yin no //
translated: This is a passage from the sutras.

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with joy.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi dga' ba dang bcas pa yin pa de'i phyir legs par bsten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi dga' ba dang bcas pa yin pa de'i phyir legs par bsten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is associated with the joy of wisdom, it is called ‚Äúwell-cultivated.‚Äù

original: bsten pa'i skad kyi dbyings ni dga' ba zhes bya ba yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten pa'i skad kyi dbyings ni dga' ba zhes bya ba yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the verbal root ‚Äúto cultivate‚Äù is held to mean ‚Äúto delight.‚Äù

original: don dam pa la 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa la 'jug phyir ro //
translated: Because it penetrates the ultimate.

original: don dam pa bdag med pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam pa bdag med pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it penetrates the ultimate, which is selflessness.

original: 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: For example, a sutra declares:

original: 'jig @197b rten kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'gog pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'jig @197b rten kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'gog pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par bstan pas so //
translated: The origin of the world and the cessation of the world are taught to be dependent origination.

original: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i spong ba dag go //
analyzed: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i spong ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, there are four right efforts.

original: bzhi gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bzhi gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di la dge slong sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed /üîΩrtsol bar byed /üîΩbrtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed / rtsol bar byed / brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: Here, monks, a monk generates desire for the non-arising of evil and unwholesome states that have not yet arisen.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed /üîΩrab tu 'jog par byed do //üîΩsdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed / rab tu 'jog par byed do // sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.üîΩHe generates desire for the abandoning of evil and unwholesome states that have already arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He generates desire for the arising of wholesome states that have not yet arisen.üîΩHe generates desire for the abiding, non-disappearance, non-reversal, and increase and abundance of wholesome states that have already arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / ye shes kyis mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed ces rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / ye shes kyis mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed ces rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: He generates zeal for the maintenance of wholesome states that have already arisen, for their non-forgetting, for their further development, for their completion by cultivation, for their arising in the future, for their increase, for their abundance, and for their realization by direct intuition.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa lta po'o //
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa lta po'o //
translated: They should be known in order as zeal, etc.

original: spang ba la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: spang ba la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Because of the desire for the relinquishment, etc. of the latter. He generates zeal for the relinquishment of the adverse elements that have already arisen.

original: de dag ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed par 'dod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed par 'dod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do //
translated: He generates zeal for the non-production of those that have not yet arisen.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed par 'dod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed par 'dod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Similarly, he generates zeal for the production of the counteragents that have not yet arisen.

original: skyes pa rnams gnas par 'dod pas 'dun pa skyed par byed do //üîΩde'i thabs yongs su gzung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni spong ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi thabs yongs su bzung ba'i phyir rtsol bar byed do //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams gnas par 'dod pas 'dun pa skyed par byed do // de'i thabs yongs su gzung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni spong ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi thabs yongs su bzung ba'i phyir rtsol bar byed do //
translated: One generates will because one wishes to maintain what has arisen.üîΩBecause one takes up the means for that, means for the abandonment, etc.

original: de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i thabs yongs su bzung ba de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i thabs yongs su bzung ba de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba ste /
translated: Because one makes that repeated and firm, means for the abandonment, etc.

original: de gnyis kyi phyir ni de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyir ni de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: One makes effort because of those two, because of the repeated and firm taking up of the means for that.

original: de la lan mang du bya ba ni rtag tu bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la lan mang du bya ba ni rtag tu bya ba nyid do //
translated: Repeated means constant.

original: brtan por bya ba ni gus par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: brtan por bya ba ni gus par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Firm means respectful.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i phyir sems rab tu 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i phyir sems rab tu 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Because it cultivates the antidotes to laxity and excitement.üîΩOne fully engages the mind in order to cultivate the antidote to laxity.

original: rgod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i phyir sems rab tu 'jog par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i phyir sems rab tu 'jog par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One fully stabilizes the mind in order to cultivate the antidote to excitement.

original: gzhan yang spang ba la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam @198a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang spang ba la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam @198a * //
translated: Moreover, because one desires to abandon, etc.

original: grangs dang po dang don mthun no //
analyzed: grangs dang po dang don mthun no //
translated: This is similar in meaning to the first alternative.

original: de dag la sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni spang ba la sogs pa de dag la sbyor ba'i phyir rtsol bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag la sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni spang ba la sogs pa de dag la sbyor ba'i phyir rtsol bar byed do //
translated: Because they are applied to those, i.e., to abandonment, etc., one makes an effort in order to apply oneself to those.

original: rnam grangs gzhan 'di yang rnam grangs snga ma dang don mthun no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan 'di yang rnam grangs snga ma dang don mthun no //
translated: This other alternative is similar in meaning to the previous alternative.üîΩIn that regard, when one who is striving, etc.

original: de la brtson pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni spang ba la sogs pa de dag la brtson pa'i lus dang sems dub par byed na ste /
analyzed: de la brtson pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni spang ba la sogs pa de dag la brtson pa'i lus dang sems dub par byed na ste /
translated: One who is striving in those abandonments, etc., tires physically and mentally.

original: lus dub par gyur pa dang / sems dub par gyur pa na brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //üîΩzhi gnas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lus dub par gyur pa dang / sems dub par gyur pa na brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do // zhi gnas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: When the body becomes tired and the mind becomes tired, he exerts his effort in order to not interrupt his effort.

original: zhi gnas kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir sems rab tu 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir sems rab tu 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He fully engages his mind in order to abandon the secondary mental afflictions through serenity.

original: lhag mthong gis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir rab tu 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir rab tu 'jog par byed do //
translated: He fully stabilizes his mind in order to abandon the secondary mental afflictions through insight.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the secondary mental afflictions?

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa gnyis so //
translated: They are the two, laxity and excitement.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang rtsol bar byed pa ni so sor rtogs pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang rtsol bar byed pa ni so sor rtogs pa'i dus na ste /
translated: Moreover, he exerts himself at the time of discernment.

original: so sor rtog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po gnyis dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon la lta ba yin par mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po gnyis dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon la lta ba yin par mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The S≈´tra states that discernment is the observation of the two, the counteragent and the object of the counteragent, and the observation of the disadvantage and the benefit.

original: dge slong dag le lo can ni sdug bsngal bar gnas shing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang 'byung bar rims nad dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi rnams dangüîΩ'dres pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag le lo can ni sdug bsngal bar gnas shing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang 'byung bar rims nad dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi rnams dang 'dres pa yin la /
translated: Monks, the lazy person lives unhappily and is mixed with the arising of sinful, nonvirtuous qualities that are defiled, that have a painful retribution, and that are mixed with birth, old age, and death in a future life.

original: de'i don chen po yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i don chen po yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: He also loses the great purpose.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rgyas par 'byung ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rgyas par 'byung ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: But the one who has begun striving is not mixed with the arising of sinful, nonvirtuous qualities.

original: sgom pa'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la brten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: sgom pa'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la brten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because at the time of cultivation, he is supported by concentration.

original: ji ltar na dus 'di gnyis su 'di gnyis la brten pa'i phyir rtsol bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dus 'di gnyis su 'di gnyis la brten pa'i phyir rtsol bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that at these two times, he is supported by these two?

original: sems zhum pa rab tu bzung nas nang du rab tu 'jog pa'i phyir na dge slong ma'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems zhum pa rab tu bzung nas nang du rab tu 'jog pa'i phyir na dge slong ma'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Because he is supported by serenity, he is able to eliminate the five hindrances and enter into the faultless state of concentration.üîΩBecause he is supported by insight, he is able to eliminate the remaining latent impressions of the passions.

analyzed: dge slong ma'i mdo sde las shin tu rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: The Bhiksuni-sutra explains this in great detail.

original: de lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na lus kyi rmugs pa dang / sems kyi zhum pa nyid du 'byung na kun dga' bo dge slong des dang bar 'gyur ba'i sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'ga' zhig yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na lus kyi rmugs pa dang / sems kyi zhum pa nyid du 'byung na kun dga' bo dge slong des dang bar 'gyur ba'i sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'ga' zhig yid la bya'o //
translated: When he dwells observing the body as a body, if there is a dullness of body and a depression of mind, then, Ananda, that bhiksu should bring to mind some agreeable object.

original: de dang bar 'gyur ba'i sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'ga' @198b zhig yid la byed pa na mchog tu dga' ba nyid skye'o //
analyzed: de dang bar 'gyur ba'i sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'ga' @198b zhig yid la byed pa na mchog tu dga' ba nyid skye'o //
translated: When he brings to mind some agreeable object, supreme joy arises.

original: mchog tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: From supreme joy, joy arises.

original: de nas gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu ba rab tu mang po rtog khang du 'dus te 'khod pa dag gtam 'di lta bu dag kun du rjod par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu ba rab tu mang po rtog khang du 'dus te 'khod pa dag gtam 'di lta bu dag kun du rjod par gyur to //
translated: Then, a great many non-Buddhist wanderers gathered in the assembly hall and engaged in the following discussion:

original: shes ldan dag 'od srungs rdzogs byed 'di ni 'dus pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'od srungs rdzogs byed 'di ni 'dus pa dang ldan pa /
translated: ‚ÄúSirs, this P≈´ra·πáa KƒÅ≈õyapa is endowed with a following,

original: tshogs dang ldan pa tshogs kyi slob dpon skye bo mang pos dge ba'i rang bzhin du kun du shes pa /
analyzed: tshogs dang ldan pa tshogs kyi slob dpon skye bo mang pos dge ba'i rang bzhin du kun du shes pa /
translated: He is known by many people as being of virtuous nature.üîΩHe is honored by the great assembly.

original: tshogs chen pos mdun gyis bdar ba'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: tshogs chen pos mdun gyis bdar ba'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //
translated: This is the passage from the sutra.

original: go rims bzhin ni nyan pa po'i tshogs 'dus pa ni 'dus pa dang ldan pa ste /üîΩ'di la 'dus pa yod pas so //üîΩ'khod pa ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin ni nyan pa po'i tshogs 'dus pa ni 'dus pa dang ldan pa ste / 'di la 'dus pa yod pas so // 'khod pa ste /

analyzed: yul gzhan la 'khod pa ni tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They are seated, because they are situated in a place other than where they were.

original: 'di la tshogs yod pas so //üîΩde rnams la rang gi bstan bcos kyis rjes su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la tshogs yod pas so // de rnams la rang gi bstan bcos kyis rjes su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They possess the accumulations, because they have the accumulations.üîΩHe teaches them his treatise.

original: nyan pa po de rnams la rang gi bstan bcos kyis rjes su ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyan pa po de rnams la rang gi bstan bcos kyis rjes su ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: He teaches them his treatise in order to instruct the listeners.

original: 'dul ba'i phyir tshogs kyi slob dpon yin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i phyir tshogs kyi slob dpon yin no //
translated: He is the master of the assembly because he disciplines them.

original: yid ches pa phun sum tshogs pa ni kun du sgrogs par byed pa mang po rnams kyis rtogs pa la yid ches pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yin gyi gzhan du na bzo'i las la ni ma yin no //

translated: The perfection of confidence is the confidence in the understanding of many who proclaim it. It is not otherwise, i.e., it is not the result of mere craftsmanship.

analyzed: 'od srungs rdzogs byed ji lta ba bzhin du kun du rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu yang de bzhin du 'dus pa dang ldan pa / chogs dang ldan pa /
translated: Just as in the case of P≈´ra·πáa KƒÅ≈õyapa, so also in the case of the wandering mendicant Maskarin Go≈õƒÅlƒ´putra, Sa√±jayin Vaira·π≠ƒ´putra, Ajita Ke≈õakambala, Kakuda KƒÅtyƒÅyana, and the naked Nirgrantha J√±ƒÅtiputra, who were all of the same assembly, the same gathering, the same communion.üîΩ They were called teachers of assemblies.

original: tshogs kyi slob dpon zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //üîΩdmag ldan chos 'di ni zab pa /
analyzed: tshogs kyi slob dpon zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no // dmag ldan chos 'di ni zab pa /
translated: The same as before.

original: zab par snang ba /üîΩmthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: zab par snang ba / mthong bar dka' ba /
translated: This Dharma is profound, profound to behold,

original: khong du chud par dka' ba /
analyzed: khong du chud par dka' ba /
translated: difficult to see, difficult to understand,üîΩnot something about which the run-of-the-mill can speak,

original: brtag mi nus pa /
analyzed: brtag mi nus pa /
translated: not something that can be examined,

original: rtog ge'i spyod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod pa ma yin pa /
translated: not something to be engaged in by logicians,üîΩ but something to be directly experienced by the noble ones.

analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su shes par bya ba yin no // 'di yang som nyi med pa nyid dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: They are to be fully understood by means of uncontaminated knowledge.üîΩThis should be connected with ‚Äúbeing free from doubt. ‚Äù

original: don mthun pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: This is the common meaning.

original: go rims tha dad pa tsam zhig khyad par yod de /
analyzed: go rims tha dad pa tsam zhig khyad par yod de /
translated: There is only a difference in order.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di las kyang mdor na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di las kyang mdor na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: In brief, this verse also teaches the perfection of knowledge and the perfection of abandonment.

original: las dang sred dang zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: las dang sred dang zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This verse should also be applied to the verse that begins with ‚Äúaction, craving, and ignorance.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: tshigs su bcad pa las las dang sred pa dang ma rig pa gsum 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i gnyen por mdo sde'i dum bu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las las dang sred pa dang ma rig pa gsum 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i gnyen por mdo sde'i dum bu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The three that appear in the verse‚Äîaction, craving, and ignorance‚Äîare the antidotes to the three that appear in the sutra passage.

original: de la 'gyod pa chad pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi gnyen por sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'gyod pa chad pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi gnyen por sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The sutra passage says, ‚Äúhaving regret,‚Äù which is the antidote to action.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from craving for existence and destruction‚Äù is the antidote to craving.

original: som nyi med pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: som nyi med pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from doubt‚Äù is the antidote to ignorance.

original: ji skad bstan pa 'di la yang go rims tha dad pa tsam zhig khyad par yod do //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa 'di la yang go rims tha dad pa tsam zhig khyad par yod do //
translated: The difference between this explanation and the previous one is merely a difference in order.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni som nyi med pa nyid kyis ni shes nas dad pa gsum thob par ston la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa thob par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni som nyi med pa nyid kyis ni shes nas dad pa gsum thob par ston la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa thob par ston to //
translated: Moreover, the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the three types of faith that are based on knowledge are obtained.

original: gang gi tshe dang de thob ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dang de thob ce na /
translated: At what point are they obtained?

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe ste /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe ste /
translated: They are obtained when the truths are realized.

original: mthong ba'i lam nas langs pa na 'di ltar kye ma @204a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam nas langs pa na 'di ltar kye ma @204a * //
translated: When one rises from the path of seeing, one thinks, ‚ÄúAh!

original: bcom ldan 'das ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Blessed One is a perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: de'i chos ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i chos ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: His Dharma is well-proclaimed.

original: de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa yin no zhes mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa yin no zhes mngon sum du byed do //
translated: His community of disciples is well-practiced.‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äúfaith that is based on knowledge‚Äù?

original: shes nas dad pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhen bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs nas dad pa ni shes nas dad pa'o //
analyzed: shes nas dad pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhen bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs nas dad pa ni shes nas dad pa'o //
translated: Faith that is based on knowledge is faith that arises from the knowledge of the truths, just as they are.

original: mthong ba'i lam kho na la 'gyod pa chad pa nyid kyis ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob bo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam kho na la 'gyod pa chad pa nyid kyis ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob bo //
translated: He obtains the morality pleasing to the noble ones, because he has eliminated regret on the path of seeing alone.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims de dag kyang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims de dag kyang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: And those moralities pleasing to the noble ones are uncontaminated vows.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa rnams dgyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa rnams dgyes pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúpleasing to the noble ones‚Äù means uncontaminated, because they are pleasing to the noble ones.

original: thugs su 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa dgyes pa dag go //
analyzed: thugs su 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa dgyes pa dag go //
translated: They are pleasing to the noble ones because they are agreeable to their minds.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na mthong ba'i lam gyi bram ze'i tshul gyis te /üîΩsom nyi med pa nyid dang 'gyod pa chad pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad bstan pa de ltar na mthong ba'i lam gyi bram ze'i tshul gyis te / som nyi med pa nyid dang 'gyod pa chad pa nyid kyis te /
translated: As it is said, in detail, ‚Äúin that way,‚Äù the path of seeing is the caste of a Brahmin, because it is free of doubt and has eliminated regret.

original: go rims bzhin du shes nas dad pa dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims gnyis kyis slob pa'i bram ze'i mtshan nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes nas dad pa dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims gnyis kyis slob pa'i bram ze'i mtshan nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: One should understand that the two characteristics of a Brahmin in training are taught by the two, faith born of insight and morality pleasing to the noble ones, respectively.

original: lhag mas de 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: lhag mas de 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The rest of the verse shows that he is free from craving for existence and destruction, and that his attachment does not increase.

original: mi slob pa'i bram ze'i mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i bram ze'i mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa /
translated: This shows the characteristics of the Brahmin who is beyond training.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩBecause he has abandoned desire and craving.

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa spangs par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags spangs par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa spangs par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags spangs par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that he has abandoned desire and craving.

original: de la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba bzhin bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni gson pa dang 'chi ba la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'dun pa spangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba bzhin bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni gson pa dang 'chi ba la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'dun pa spangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúfree from craving for existence and destruction‚Äù shows that he has abandoned desire, respectively, because he is not attached to life and death.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is that done?

original: 'byung ba la sred pa dang bral ba ni gson pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir 'dun pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba la sred pa dang bral ba ni gson pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir 'dun pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: One who is free of craving for emergence abandons aspiration because one is not manifestly pleased with life.

original: 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba ni 'chi ba la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir 'dun pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba ni 'chi ba la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir 'dun pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: One who is free of craving for destruction abandons aspiration because one is not manifestly pleased with death.

original: ji skad du gnas brtan ma 'gags pas /
analyzed: ji skad du gnas brtan ma 'gags pas /
translated: As the elder Aniruddha said:

original: 'chi la mngon par mi dga' la //
analyzed: 'chi la mngon par mi dga' la //
translated: I am not manifestly pleased with death

original: gson la'ang mngon par mi dga'o //
analyzed: gson la'ang mngon par mi dga'o //
translated: nor am I manifestly pleased with life.

original: shes bzhin dang ni dran pa yis //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ni dran pa yis //
translated: With mindfulness and introspection

original: lus la so sor brtags par bya //
analyzed: lus la so sor brtags par bya //
translated: I examine the body.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: One who is conceited, etc.

original: @204b mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni zab mo la ste /
analyzed: @204b mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni zab mo la ste /
translated: One who is conceited is doubtful about the profound, i.e., the emptiness of essence of all things.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig la zhe na //üîΩstong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod pa na som nyi za ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig la zhe na // stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod pa na som nyi za ste /
translated: What is it like?

original: yid gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: When the teaching that is endowed with emptiness is expressed, he is doubtful, i.e., he has uncertainty.

original: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di ba nyid dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di ba nyid dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The teaching on emptiness is also in accord with dependent origination and this conditionality.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'du byed la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di la rkyen ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di yod pas de ni rkyen 'di pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'du byed la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di la rkyen ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di yod pas de ni rkyen 'di pa ste /
translated: Because the members such as ignorance are devoid of activity, this dharma characterized by the formative forces, etc. exists when this dharma characterized by the condition of ignorance, etc. exists. Therefore, it is this conditionality.

original: de'i dngos po ni rkyen 'di pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni rkyen 'di pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is this conditionality.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid rkyen 'di pa nyid yin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di pa nyid do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid rkyen 'di pa nyid yin pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di pa nyid do //
translated: Since dependent origination is this conditionality, it is dependent origination and this conditionality.

original: de dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa ste /
translated: In accord with that;

original: rjes su mthun pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di pa nyid dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen 'di pa nyid dang mthun pa'o //
translated: in conformity with that is in accord with dependent origination and this conditionality.

original: phyis kyang yid la gcags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis kyang yid la gcags par 'gyur te /
translated: One will also regret it later.

original: ji skad du lha'i mdo las gsungs pa lta bu yin zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyas par gsungs nas ma thob par thob pa'i 'du shes can dang / ma rtogs par rtogs pa'i 'du shes can dang / mngon sum du ma byas par mngon sum du byas pa'i 'du shes can de ni de las phyis rnam par nyams shing phongs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du lha'i mdo las gsungs pa lta bu yin zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyas par gsungs nas ma thob par thob pa'i 'du shes can dang / ma rtogs par rtogs pa'i 'du shes can dang / mngon sum du ma byas par mngon sum du byas pa'i 'du shes can de ni de las phyis rnam par nyams shing phongs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has the notion of obtaining what has not been obtained, the notion of realizing what has not been realized, the notion of actualizing what has not been actualized, later falls away and is ruined.‚Äù

original: de ltar yid la gcags pa yin no //üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal can de lus sam snyams par 'jug pa la sred pa kun du 'byung la /
analyzed: de ltar yid la gcags pa yin no // mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de lus sam snyams par 'jug pa la sred pa kun du 'byung la /
translated: Thus there is mental anguish.üîΩThe latent tendency of desire arises in one who is conceited about spiritual attainments, when he enters into the bliss of the body.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de nyid la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de nyid la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba kho na nyid yin no //
translated: The latent tendency of passion always follows one who is conceited about spiritual attainments.

original: de ltar na mdo sde'i dum bu 'di rnams kyis ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad du bstan pa rnams kyi gnyen por bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de nyid la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal med pa
analyzed: de ltar na mdo sde'i dum bu 'di rnams kyis ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad du bstan pa rnams kyi gnyen por bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de nyid la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal med pa
translated: Thus these passages from sutra teach that the antidote to the manifest pride of the brahmans is to be without the latent tendency of attachment to the status of a brahman.

original: nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these passages from the sutra teach that the Brahmin is free from the latent dispositions of desire, as an antidote to the secondary afflictions of pride in Brahmin status as they are taught.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this done?

original: som nyi'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por som nyi med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: som nyi'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por som nyi med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase free from doubt is stated as an antidote to the secondary affliction of doubt.

original: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: This also teaches that the Brahmin is free from pride in Brahmin status.

original: yid la gcags pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'gyod pa chad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yid la gcags pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'gyod pa chad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase free from regret is stated as an antidote to the secondary affliction of remorse.

original: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: This also teaches that the Brahmin is free from pride in Brahmin status.

original: sred pa pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'byung ba @205a * //
analyzed: sred pa pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'byung ba @205a * //
translated: The phrase free from craving is stated as an antidote to the secondary affliction of craving.

original: dang 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dang 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and ‚Äúfree from craving for arising and destruction.‚Äù

original: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //

original: 'dod chags kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan te bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bram ze nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid du yongs su bstan te bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgoms shig / dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas /üîΩbgrod par byas /üîΩrtan  du byas /
analyzed: dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgoms shig / dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas / bgrod par byas / rtan  du byas /
translated: Monks, if you attend to the perception of impermanence, develop it,üîΩmake it your vehicle,

original: nan tan du byas /
analyzed: nan tan du byas /
translated: make it your basis,üîΩmake it your island,üîΩmake it your refuge,üîΩmake it your final goal,

analyzed: shin tu rdzogs par byas shing legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /

analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa thams cad mang dag par 'joms te /
translated: all attachment to the form realm, all attachment to the formless realm, all agitation, all pride, and all ignorance are destroyed.

analyzed: dper na khyim bdag zhing pa dbyar 'das nas ston gyi dus kyi tshe gshol chen pos zhing rnams rmed pa na ram pa'i rtsa rgyus thams cad gcod par byed /

analyzed: kun du gcod par byed mngon du gcod par byed pa de bzhin du dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bstan zhing bsgoms la lan mang du byas bgrod bar byas zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: he cuts them all, he cuts them down. In the same way, monks, when the perception of impermanence is taught, cultivated, practiced, and made familiar,

analyzed: dge slong dag dper na mi rtsva ba la ba dza rnga ba zhig gis rtsva ba la ba ja chung zhing nyung la mi mang ba shas cig mchog nas bzung ste /
translated: For example, monks, a man with a sharp razor would take a small amount of grass, a small amount of chaff, a small amount of sticks, and

analyzed: spug cing bar bur thams cad sel bar byed pa de bzhin du mir tag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten zhing zhes bya ba nas nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i bar du yang dag par 'joms so //
translated: Just as a tree with a hollow trunk is hollow everywhere, in the same way, by relying on the perception of impermanence...

analyzed: dper na shing thog aa mra'i dog pa la aa mra gang yin pa de thams cad ni rtsa rgyus dang ldan pa /
translated: Just as all mangoes in a mango grove have a stalk,
