analyzed: rtsa rgyus la brten pa / rtsa rgyus dang 'brel pa /
translated: are supported by a stalk,üîΩare connected to a stalk,

original: rtsa rgyus dang 'du ba /
analyzed: rtsa rgyus dang 'du ba /
translated: are joined to a stalk,

original: rtsa rgyus dang ma bral ba dag yin zhing /
analyzed: rtsa rgyus dang ma bral ba dag yin zhing /
translated: and are not separate from a stalk,

original: de dag las byung ba yin pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba yin pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and arise from a stalk, in the same way, by relying on the perception of impermanence...

original: dper na gtsang khang byur bu'i phyam dgu bo gang ji snyed pa de thams cad spyi rten la gnas /üîΩspyi rten la brten /üîΩspyi rten la rag las /
analyzed: dper na gtsang khang byur bu'i phyam dgu bo gang ji snyed pa de thams cad spyi rten la gnas / spyi rten la brten / spyi rten la rag las /
translated: Just as all the nine layers of the roof of a temple rest on the foundation,üîΩare supported by the foundation,

original: spyi rten la gzhol bas /
analyzed: spyi rten la gzhol bas /
translated: depend on the foundation,üîΩare fixed to the foundation,üîΩand are not separate from the foundation,

original: spyi rten ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
analyzed: spyi rten ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
translated: The universal basis is taught to be the best of those.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: kun du 'dzin pa'i @205b phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa'i @205b phyir ro //
translated: Because it holds all.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the perception of impermanence is as before.üîΩFor example, the footprints of all the various animals that are included in the animal realm are included in and contained within the footprint of the elephant.

original: dper na srog chags dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi rjes gang ji snyed pa de thams cad glang po che'i rjes su 'dus shing khongs su chud pas glang po che'i rjes ni de rnams kyi mchog tu bstan te /
analyzed: dper na srog chags dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi rjes gang ji snyed pa de thams cad glang po che'i rjes su 'dus shing khongs su chud pas glang po che'i rjes ni de rnams kyi mchog tu bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the elephant's footprint is taught to be the best of those.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the greatest.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the perception of impermanence is as before.

original: dper na 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'bab chu gang ji snyed yod pa de thams cad ni rgya mtshor gzhol ba /
analyzed: dper na 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'bab chu gang ji snyed yod pa de thams cad ni rgya mtshor gzhol ba /
translated: For example, all the rivers in Jambudvipa flow to the ocean,

original: rgya mtshor 'bab pa /
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'bab pa /
translated: flow into the ocean,

original: rgya mtshor bab pa yin pas rgya mtsho ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
analyzed: rgya mtshor bab pa yin pas rgya mtsho ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
translated: and reach the ocean. Therefore, the ocean is taught to be the best of those.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: kun du sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it completely subsumes them.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is the best of all perceptions.

original: dper na gnam las nyi ma shar ba ni gnam la yog ma'i mun pa thams cad 'od kyis zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: dper na gnam las nyi ma shar ba ni gnam la yog ma'i mun pa thams cad 'od kyis zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: For example, when the sun rises in the sky, it outshines all the light of the stars and the glow-¬≠worms.üîΩIt shines,

original: lham me lhan ne lhag ge'o //
analyzed: lham me lhan ne lhag ge'o //
translated: blazes, and glows.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is the best of all perceptions.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni khams kyi rgyal po gang ji snyed pa de rnams kyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni khams kyi rgyal po gang ji snyed pa de rnams kyi mchog yin te /
translated: For example, the universal monarch is the most excellent of all the kings of the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because

original: dbang byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dbang byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: he has dominion over them.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten zhing bsgoms la lan mang du byas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun du bsten zhing bsgoms la lan mang du byas /
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence, when it is developed, made much of,üîΩmastered,

original: bgrod par byas /üîΩrten du byas /
analyzed: bgrod par byas / rten du byas /
translated: made a vehicle,üîΩmade a basis,

original: nan tan du byas /
analyzed: nan tan du byas /
translated: made firm,

original: shin tu rdzogs par byas shing legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /
analyzed: shin tu rdzogs par byas shing legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /
translated: and well undertaken, completely conquers all sensual desire.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms so //
translated: It completely destroys all attachment to form, all attachment to the formless, all agitation, pride, and ignorance.

original: zhing pa la sogs pa'i dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / rtsva ba la ba dza la sogs pa'i dpe dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zhing pa la sogs pa'i dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / rtsva ba la ba dza la sogs pa'i dpe dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is along with the examples of the farmer, etc., because it is along with the examples of the peaceful one, the cotton-wool gatherer, etc.

original: ldan pa ni zhing pa la sogs pa'i dpe dang bcas pa'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa ma byung ba dang / byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zhing pa'i dpes ni nyon mongs pa ma byung ba bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir gnyen po nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: ldan pa ni zhing pa la sogs pa'i dpe dang bcas pa'o // nyon mongs pa ma byung ba dang / byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zhing pa'i dpes ni nyon mongs pa ma byung ba bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir gnyen po nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: The possessor is along with the examples of the farmer, etc.üîΩBecause it is based on the non-arising and arising of the defilements.üîΩBy the example of the farmer, it is taught as the antidote based on the state of latent defilements that have not arisen.

original: rtsva ba la ba dza'i dpes ni nyon mongs pa byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po nyid du'o //
analyzed: rtsva ba la ba dza'i dpes ni nyon mongs pa byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po nyid du'o //
translated: By the example of the cotton-wool gatherer, it is based on the arising of the defilements, as the antidote to the fetters.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de las gzhan pa ste /
translated: The other is the other than the perception of impermanence.

original: de dag ni de las gzhan @206a * //
analyzed: de dag ni de las gzhan @206a * //
translated: These are the other than that.üîΩThe perception of wishlessness, the perception of emptiness, and the perception of signlessness.

original: pa'o // smon pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes dag ces bya ba ni de la smon pa med pa'i 'du shes ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: pa'o // smon pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes dag ces bya ba ni de la smon pa med pa'i 'du shes ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: The perception of wishlessness is the perception of the aspects of impermanence, suffering, cause, origination,

original: rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang / lam dang / rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang / lam dang / rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: arising, condition, path, knowledge, practice, and definitive release.

original: stong pa nyid kyi 'du shes ni stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi 'du shes ni stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of emptiness is the perception of the aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes ni 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i 'du shes de dag ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes ni 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i 'du shes de dag ste /
translated: The perception of signlessness is the perception of the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release.

original: aa mra'i dog pa'i dpes ni de las gzhan pa'i 'du shes dag 'dren par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: aa mra'i dog pa'i dpes ni de las gzhan pa'i 'du shes dag 'dren par byed pa yin no //
translated: The example of the mango shows that one can have other notions.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes las gzhan ni de las gzhan pa ste de dag go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes las gzhan ni de las gzhan pa ste de dag go //
translated: Other than that means other than the notion of impermanence.

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dag ni mi sdug pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rdu dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la sogs pa'i 'du shes dag go //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dag ni mi sdug pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rdu dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la sogs pa'i 'du shes dag go //
translated: The notions of foulness, etc. are the notions of foulness, of disease, of abscess, of thorn, of misery, of calamity, of affliction, of something alien, of oppression, of change, of impermanence, of suffering, of emptiness, and of nonself, of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, etc.

original: ji ltar na mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dag kun du 'dzin par byed pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dag kun du 'dzin par byed pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
translated: How is it that the notions of foulness, etc. are taught to be the means of apprehending?

original: yongs su mi nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not deteriorate.

original: 'di ltar mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes de dag las yongs su mi nyams par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes de dag las yongs su mi nyams par 'gyur bas so //
translated: For one does not deteriorate from those notions of foulness, etc.

original: de dag nyid ces bya ba ni smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes de dag nyid mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa nyid yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid ces bya ba ni smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes de dag nyid mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa nyid yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust those‚Äù refers to the very same perceptions of wishlessness, etc. that are included within the sphere of the perception of impermanence.

original: de la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul te dmigs pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul te dmigs pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe sphere of the perception of impermanence‚Äù means the object of the perception of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud par byed pas na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud par byed pas na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúincluded within the sphere of the perception of impermanence‚Äù means that they are included within the sphere of the perception of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa rnams kyi dngos po ni mi rtag pa'i spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa rnams kyi dngos po ni mi rtag pa'i spyod yul gyi nang du chud pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúincluded within the sphere of the perception of impermanence‚Äù means that they are included within the sphere of the perception of impermanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mi rtag pa nyid du yongs su rtag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du yongs su rtag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are to be fully understood as impermanent.

original: 'di ltar smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes de dag ni mi rtag pa'o zhes yongs su rtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde las gzhan pa sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de las so //
analyzed: 'di ltar smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes de dag ni mi rtag pa'o zhes yongs su rtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de las gzhan pa sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de las so //
translated: Thus, the perception of wishlessness, etc. is impermanent, because it is to be fully understood.üîΩOther aspects of disenchantment, etc.

original: gzhan pa sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa @206b dag ces bya ba ni nad nyid dang / 'bras nyid dang / zug rdu nyid dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhan pa sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa @206b dag ces bya ba ni nad nyid dang / 'bras nyid dang / zug rdu nyid dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: Other aspects of disenchantment, etc. are the aspects of disease, abscess, thorn, and calamity, etc.üîΩIt is concluded in the perception of impermanence.

original: der thug pa nyid ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes su thug pa nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der thug pa nyid ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes su thug pa nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is taught that it is concluded in the perception of impermanence; this is the meaning.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it concluded?

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the entry into the suffering of the formative forces.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'jug pas so //
translated: The perception of impermanence is the entry into the suffering of the formative forces.

original: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does the perception of impermanence engage the suffering of the formative forces?

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes de ltar mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes de ltar mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is convinced that whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: One becomes detached from all contaminated things through the suffering of the formative forces,

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa gzhan rnams kyis ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa gzhan rnams kyis ni ma yin pas so //
translated: but not through the other forms of spiritual disgust.

original: de ltar na der thug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na der thug pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the ultimate.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid ces bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal bas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid ces bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal bas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: The suffering of the formative forces is the suffering of the formative forces because of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de'i dngos po ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The nature of this is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nyi mas ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi slob pa'i mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni mi brjed pa'i chos nyid du byed pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nyi mas ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi slob pa'i mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni mi brjed pa'i chos nyid du byed pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin due order‚Äù means that the sun is taught to be the reality of nonforgetting in the state of no learning, and the perception of impermanence in the state of no learning.

original: khams kyi rgyal po gzhan gyis ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi slob pa'i 'du shes ni /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i 'du shes gzhan las dbang sgyur ba nyid yin par yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: khams kyi rgyal po gzhan gyis ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi slob pa'i 'du shes ni / 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes gzhan las dbang sgyur ba nyid yin par yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: The other kings of the elements are taught to be the mastery of other perceptions in the state of no learning.

original: de dag ji ltar 'dod par mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dod par mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they manifest as they wish.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes de dag kyang mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rdu la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes de dag kyang mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rdu la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those other perceptions are the perception of foulness, the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and the perception of disease, abscess, and thorn.üîΩThus, etc.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba na de ltar zhing pa'i dpe dang / rtsva bal ba dza'i dpes ni ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba na de ltar zhing pa'i dpe dang / rtsva bal ba dza'i dpes ni ji ltar na /
translated: The example of the farmer and the example of the wool of the ba¬∑ja plant show how the perception of impermanence is the reality of nonforgetting in the state of no learning.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni mtha' dag ni gnyen po yin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni mtha' dag ni gnyen po yin pa yang yin te /
translated: The ideation of impermanence is the antidote to all,

original: bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir na de yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir na de yongs su bstan te /
translated: because it is the antidote to the latent impressions and the envelopments.

original: aa mra'i dog pa'i dpes ni ji ltar na gnyen po'i rtsa ba yin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: aa mra'i dog pa'i dpes ni ji ltar na gnyen po'i rtsa ba yin pa yang yin te /
translated: The example of the mango shows how the ideation of impermanence is the root of the antidotes,

original: gnyen po gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir na de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir na de yongs su bstan to //
translated: because it produces the other antidotes.

original: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po gzhan te /üîΩmi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams las khyad par rnam pa gsum dag gis khyad @207a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po gzhan te / mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams las khyad par rnam pa gsum dag gis khyad @207a * //
translated: How is the ideation of impermanence the antidote to the envelopments?

original: par du 'phags pa yin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: par du 'phags pa yin pa yang yin no //
translated: The ideation of impermanence is superior to the ideations of foulness, etc., in three ways.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /

original: spyi rten gyis ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / glang po che'i rjes kyis ni de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'bab chu rnams kyis de ni las gzhan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /

original: smra ba po'i yon tan las brtsams nas kyang 'dir rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba po'i yon tan las brtsams nas kyang 'dir rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, having begun the qualities of the speaker, it should be understood in five aspects.üîΩThe five aspects are: speaking with a mind of loving kindness, speaking with a mind of compassion, and so on up toüîΩspeaking with a mind of equanimity.

original: byams pa'i sems nas gzhan la smad par mi bya ba'i bar 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems nas gzhan la smad par mi bya ba'i bar 'di dag yin no //
translated: From a loving mind, one should not disparage others.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag chos nyan par 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag chos nyan par 'dod pas ni /
translated: Venerable ones, those who wish to listen to the Dharma

original: rnam pa bcu drug dag dang ldan pas chos mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug dag dang ldan pas chos mnyan par bya ste /
translated: should listen to the Dharma with sixteen aspects.

original: dus su chos mnyan par bya ba dang / bkur sti dang nyan par gus pa dang / ma rangs pa med pa dang / bsgo ba bzhin byed pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang / chos la gus @210b pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: dus su chos mnyan par bya ba dang / bkur sti dang nyan par gus pa dang / ma rangs pa med pa dang / bsgo ba bzhin byed pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang / chos la gus @210b pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: One should listen to the Dharma at the proper time, with respect and reverence for listening, without displeasure, doing as one is told, not seeking fault, establishing respect for the Dharma,

original: gang zag chos smra ba la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / gang zag chos smra ba la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / kun du shes par bya ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: gang zag chos smra ba la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / gang zag chos smra ba la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / kun du shes par bya ba'i sems dang /
translated: establishing respect for the person teaching the Dharma, without contempt for the Dharma, without contempt for the person teaching the Dharma, without contempt for oneself, with a mind to fully understand,

original: sems rtse gcig tu bya ba dang rna blags pa dang / sems kun du btud pa dang / sems thams cad kyis bsams nas chos mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu bya ba dang rna blags pa dang / sems kun du btud pa dang / sems thams cad kyis bsams nas chos mnyan par bya ste /
translated: One should listen to the Dharma with a one-pointed mind, with ears attuned, with a humble mind, with a mind that is fully intent.üîΩVenerable Ones, one should listen to the Dharma with these sixteen aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag rnam ba bcu drug po 'di dag dang ldan pas chos mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no //üîΩsmra ba po la bdag nyid kyis bskyod pa dang spyod lam gyi skyon gyi gnyan por dus su chos mnyan par bya ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag rnam ba bcu drug po 'di dag dang ldan pas chos mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu yin no // smra ba po la bdag nyid kyis bskyod pa dang spyod lam gyi skyon gyi gnyan por dus su chos mnyan par bya ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the section on the sutra.üîΩOne should listen to the Dharma at the proper time, as an antidote to the fault of being distracted by oneself or by one's deportment. This is the aspect of the speaker.

original: 'gying ba'i skyon gyi gnyen por bkur sti'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gying ba'i skyon gyi gnyen por bkur sti'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: One should listen to the Dharma with respect, as an antidote to the fault of being disrespectful.üîΩOne should listen to the Dharma with a humble mind, as an antidote to the fault of being arrogant.

original: don du mi gnyer ba nyid kyi skyon gyi gnyen por nyan par gus pas zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba nyid kyi skyon gyi gnyen por nyan par gus pas zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
translated: One should listen to the Dharma with a mind that is fully intent, as an antidote to the fault of not being interested.

original: nyan par gus pa ni nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan par gus pa ni nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Being fully intent means being desirous of listening.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs byed pas snying na ba'i skyon gyi gnyen por ma rangs pa med pas zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs byed pas snying na ba'i skyon gyi gnyen por ma rangs pa med pas zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of being displeased because of doing the opponent's work is the aspect called not being displeased.

original: mchod par mi 'gyur bas smra ba po rab tu mi 'dzin pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por bsgom pa bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod par mi 'gyur bas smra ba po rab tu mi 'dzin pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por bsgom pa bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of not holding the speaker in high regard because of not being worshipped is the aspect called acting like a meditation.

original: sun ci phyin du brgal ba'i bsam pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por kan ka mi tshol ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: sun ci phyin du brgal ba'i bsam pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por kan ka mi tshol ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of the attitude of refuting what is not refuted is the aspect called not seeking faults.

original: chos dang chos smra ba la yon tan yid la mi byed pa'i phyir rim gro med pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / gang zag chos smra ba la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di gnyis yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos smra ba la yon tan yid la mi byed pa'i phyir rim gro med pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / gang zag chos smra ba la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di gnyis yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of not being respectful because of not keeping in mind the good qualities of the teaching and the teacher is the pair of aspects called keeping in mind respect for the teaching and keeping in mind respect for the person who teaches the Dharma.

original: skyon yid la byed pa'i phyir brnyas pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por chos la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / gang zag chos smra ba la brnyas pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa 'di gnyis yin no //
analyzed: skyon yid la byed pa'i phyir brnyas pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por chos la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / gang zag chos smra ba la brnyas pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa 'di gnyis yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of contempt is the pair of aspects called ‚Äúabsence of contempt for the teaching‚Äù and ‚Äúabsence of contempt for the person who teaches the Dharma.‚Äù

original: smod pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: smod pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of disparaging is the aspect called ‚Äúabsence of disparagement of oneself.‚Äù

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa nyid kyi skyon gyi gnyen por kun du shes par bya ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa nyid kyi skyon gyi gnyen por kun du shes par bya ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin te /
translated: The antidote to the fault of desiring gain and honor is the aspect called ‚Äúthe attitude of wanting to understand.‚Äù

original: de la ni kun du shes par bya ba ste /üîΩkhong du chud par bya ba'i sems 'byung gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa nyid ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ni kun du shes par bya ba ste / khong du chud par bya ba'i sems 'byung gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa nyid ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In this case, the attitude of wanting to understand arises,üîΩbut the desire for gain and honor does not arise.

original: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / bsdus pa gnyis kyis mi nyan @211a * //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / bsdus pa gnyis kyis mi nyan @211a * //
translated: One does not listen with a distracted or contracted mind.

original: pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du sems rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / rna blags pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di gnyis yin no //
analyzed: pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du sems rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / rna blags pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di gnyis yin no //
translated: The two aspects of ‚Äúwith a one-pointed mind‚Äù and ‚Äúwith ears perked up‚Äù are, respectively, the antidotes to the faults of distraction and drowsiness.

original: legs par yid la mi byed pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por sems kun du btud pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: legs par yid la mi byed pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por sems kun du btud pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
translated: The aspect of ‚Äúwith a mind that is fully composed‚Äù is the antidote to the fault of not properly attending to the Dharma.

original: sems kun du btud pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang bar byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems kun du btud pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang bar byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWith a mind that is fully composed‚Äù means ‚Äúwith a clear mind.‚Äù

original: sems nyid sems so //
analyzed: sems nyid sems so //
translated: The mind itself is the one that is clear.

original: rab tu yid la mi byed pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por sems thams cad kyis bsams nas chos mnyan par bya ste zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: rab tu yid la mi byed pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por sems thams cad kyis bsams nas chos mnyan par bya ste zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
translated: The aspect of ‚Äúlistening to the Dharma with all one‚Äôs mind‚Äù is the antidote to the fault of not properly attending to the Dharma.

original: de la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la skyon ji skad bstan pa rnams las skyon gyi tshig kha cig slob dpon gyis rnam par bshad pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la skyon ji skad bstan pa rnams las skyon gyi tshig kha cig slob dpon gyis rnam par bshad pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: With regard to that, the master has explained some of the terms that refer to faults as they have been presented.

original: smra ba po nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i tshe nyan pa po nyan pa'i phyir dang / nyan pa po spyod lam mi sdug pas nyan pa'i phyir katya'i bu mo smyug ma can gyi mdo las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smra ba po nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i tshe nyan pa po nyan pa'i phyir dang / nyan pa po spyod lam mi sdug pas nyan pa'i phyir katya'i bu mo smyug ma can gyi mdo las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: When the speaker is in meditative seclusion, the listener may not listen because of the speaker's silence, or the listener may listen with an unpleasant manner.

original: 'di ni skyon dang po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon dang po yin te /
translated: This is the first fault.

original: smra ba po la bdag nyid kyis bskyod pa dang / spyod lam gyi skyon zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po la bdag nyid kyis bskyod pa dang / spyod lam gyi skyon zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The fault of the speaker is called self-motion and the fault of the listener is called unpleasant manner.

original: rigs mthon po nyid la sogs par nga rgyal 'byung ba'i phyir skyon no //
analyzed: rigs mthon po nyid la sogs par nga rgyal 'byung ba'i phyir skyon no //
translated: It is a fault because pride arises from the thought that one is of high caste, etc.üîΩThe words etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rigs pa dang / rus dang / na tshod dang / byad gzugs dang / thos pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rigs pa dang / rus dang / na tshod dang / byad gzugs dang / thos pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
translated: include reason, family, age, beauty, learning, etc.

original: chos dang chos smra ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par bstan pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos smra ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par bstan pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the passage beginning with the Dharma and the preacher of the Dharma is as follows.

original: chos la ni yon tan legs par gsungs pa nyid du dang / 'bras bu chen po nyid du ste /
analyzed: chos la ni yon tan legs par gsungs pa nyid du dang / 'bras bu chen po nyid du ste /
translated: The Dharma is well-spoken in terms of its good qualities and it has great results.

original: legs par gsungs pa nyid du dang / 'bras bu chen po nyid du'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa nyid du dang / 'bras bu chen po nyid du'o //
translated: It is well spoken and has great fruit.

original: chos smra ba la ni yon tan dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid yin par ro //
analyzed: chos smra ba la ni yon tan dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid yin par ro //
translated: The qualities of the Dharma teacher are that he is a spiritual friend.

original: skyon yid la byed pa'i phyir brnyas pa'i skyon zhes bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par bshad pa yang /
analyzed: skyon yid la byed pa'i phyir brnyas pa'i skyon zhes bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par bshad pa yang /
translated: The fault of contempt was taught above. Its explanation is:

original: chos la skyon ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos la skyon ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The fault of the Dharma is...

original: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / bsdus pa gnyis kyis mi nyan pa'i skyon zhes bstan pa gang yin pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang /
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / bsdus pa gnyis kyis mi nyan pa'i skyon zhes bstan pa gang yin pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang /
translated: The fault of not listening was taught above with the two, distraction and contraction. Its explanation is:

original: rnam par g-yengs pa ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Distraction is...üîΩThe fault of not properly paying attention was taught above. Its explanation is:

original: legs par yid la mi byed pa'i skyon zhes bstan pa gang yin pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang dgongs pa dang / chos nyid la zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par yid la mi byed pa'i skyon zhes bstan pa gang yin pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang dgongs pa dang / chos nyid la zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The intention and the nature of the Dharma...

original: ji ltar na legs par yid la mi byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na legs par yid la mi byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one does not properly pay attention?

original: dgongs @211b pa dang / chos nyid la phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: dgongs @211b pa dang / chos nyid la phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis te /
translated: by the non-erroneousness of the intention and the reality.

original: dgongs pa la phyin ci log pa nyid kyis dang / chos nyid la phyin ci log pa nyid kyis so //üîΩde la dgongs pa la phyin ci log pa nyid ni tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba dang / pha dang ma ni bsad byas shing //
analyzed: dgongs pa la phyin ci log pa nyid kyis dang / chos nyid la phyin ci log pa nyid kyis so // de la dgongs pa la phyin ci log pa nyid ni tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba dang / pha dang ma ni bsad byas shing //
translated: The intention is erroneous and the reality is erroneous.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the intention is erroneous, such as when it is said: ‚ÄúWhatever feeling there is, that is suffering here‚Äù and ‚ÄúHaving killed one‚Äôs father and mother,üîΩthe king of the land is pleased.‚Äù

original: chos nyid la phyin ci log pa nyid ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rang bzhin dang / skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa yin no zhes de lta bu la sogs par rgyu phyin ci log tu bstan to //
analyzed: chos nyid la phyin ci log pa nyid ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rang bzhin dang / skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa yin no zhes de lta bu la sogs par rgyu phyin ci log tu bstan to //
translated: The reality is erroneous, such as when it is taught that the cause is erroneous, as in the statement: ‚ÄúConsciousness has ignorance for its causal condition‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe cause of the world is God, Puru·π£a, ƒ™≈õvara, etc.‚Äù

original: rab tu yid la mi byed pa'i skyon zhes bstan pa gang yin pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang rab tu yid la mi byed pa ni 'dun pa dang / 'jug pa zhan pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rab tu yid la mi byed pa'i skyon zhes bstan pa gang yin pa 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yang rab tu yid la mi byed pa ni 'dun pa dang / 'jug pa zhan pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The explanation of the fault of not paying attention is that it is due to weak aspiration and weak application.

original: 'dun pa zhan pa nyid kyis dang / 'jug pa zhan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhan pa nyid kyis dang / 'jug pa zhan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is due to weak aspiration and weak application.

original: 'dun pa ni byed par 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni byed par 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to act.

original: 'jug pa ni yid la byed pa'o //üîΩlas kyi skyon zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las nyid skyon yin pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni yid la byed pa'o // las kyi skyon zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las nyid skyon yin pas so //
translated: Application is mental attention.üîΩThe fault of action is a fault of action.

original: las kyi skyon yin pa nas /
analyzed: las kyi skyon yin pa nas /
translated: The fault of action is a fault of action.

original: 'dzin pa'i bar nyid skyon yin pas 'dzin pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i bar nyid skyon yin pas 'dzin pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: The fault of grasping is a fault of grasping.

original: lus kyi las kyi skyon ni spyod lam mi sdug par 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi skyon ni spyod lam mi sdug par 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of bodily action is sitting in an unattractive posture.

analyzed: skyon de'i gnyen por dus su chos mnyan par bya zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //

original: lus dang ngag gi las kyi skyon ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyi skyon ji lta bu zhe na /

original: de gnyis kyis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir te /

original: lus kyis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir dang / ngag gis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir dang / ngag gis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i gnyen por bkur sti zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bkur sti zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //

original: yid kyi las kyi skyon ni nyan par mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid kyi las kyi skyon ni nyan par mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //

original: de'i gnyen por nyan par gus pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por nyan par gus pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
translated: The antidote to that is the aspect that is respectful listening.

original: mos pa med pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por ma rangs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: mos pa med pa'i skyon gyi gnyen por ma rangs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of lack of interest is the aspect that is lack of displeasure.

original: mchod bar mi 'gyur ba'i skyon gyi gnyen por bsgo ba bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod bar mi 'gyur ba'i skyon gyi gnyen por bsgo ba bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The antidote to the fault of not making offerings is the aspect that is doing as one is told.

original: bsgo ba bzhin byed ba ni mig rtsa dang bzhin la sogs pas dang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba bzhin byed ba ni mig rtsa dang bzhin la sogs pas dang bar ston pa'o //
translated: Doing as one is told is showing one's pleasure with one's eyes, face, and so on.

original: bsam pa'i skyon ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa'i skyon ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of attitude?

original: gzhan la klan ka btsal ba dang / 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: gzhan la klan ka btsal ba dang / 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam ba nyid kyis te /
translated: By the thought of finding fault with others and being freed from this kind of dispute.

analyzed: gzhan la klan ka btsal ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis dang / 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las @212a * // thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the thought of finding fault with others and by the thought of being freed from this kind of dispute.

original: 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa ni 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa ni 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa ste /

analyzed: the tshom gcod pa'i mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir ni yang dag par mgu bar bya ba yin no //

analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir ni yongs su mgu bar bya ba yin no //

translated: Thus, through the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness, he abides

analyzed: bdag nyid gling du 'gyur bar gnas pa dang / bdag nyid skyabs su 'gyur bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes yang dag par ston pa yin no //

analyzed: bdag gling du 'gyur ba dang / chos gling du 'gyur ba dang / gling gzhan ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra la brten pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa'i chos la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: 'di gsum zhes bya ba ni bdag dang / chos dang / gzhan ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni rga shi la thug pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gzhan yang ste /

analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa skyes pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ni bdag nyid gling du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, means by another method. Since it is the antidote to the arising of the afflictions, it is an island for oneself.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ni bdag nyid skyabs su 'gyur ba yin no //
